The position requires extensive cross functional collaborations working with a diverse team of clinical subject matter experts, data scientists, statisticians, and business leads to inform the research and development of our molecules, and support healthcare decisions by patients, physicians, health authorities, payers, and policy-makers. <br/><br/> Responsibilities: <ul> <li>IDENTIFY EVIDENCE NEEDS &amp; RECOMMEND DATA SOLUTIONS: Ask the right scientific questions, understand the evidence needs for research and development, regulatory and market access, and ideate and make recommendations on fit-for-purpose data and analytics solutions.</li><li>DEVELOP DATA STRATEGY &amp; GAIN ACCESS TO DATA: Develop strategic plans to access fit-for-purpose data sources to support evidence generation, and gain access to data through collaboration or data generation.</li><li>DIVE INTO DATA: Develop a comprehensive and deep understanding of the data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications to broaden data accessibility and advance our proficiency/efficiency in understanding and using the data appropriately.</li><li>BE AN EXPERT IN APPLYING METHODS: Stay current with and adopt emergent analytical methodologies, tools and applications to ensure fit-for-purpose and impactful approaches.</li><li>PRODUCE HIGH QUALITY ANALYSES: Apply rigor in study design and analytical methods; plan for data processing; design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability; implement and/or oversee the study, including its reporting; ensure compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.</li><li>INTERPRET AND SHARE RESULTS: Communicate findings to internal stakeholders, regulatory, health technology assessment (HTA) bodies and scientific communities; publish results; participate in external meetings and forums to present your insights (e.g. in academic setting).</li><li>Experience in conducting observational research</li><li>Expertise in clinical trials or in development of diagnostics or medical devices</li><li>Proficiency in English, both written and verbal</li><li>Preferred: Experience in regulatory submissions of molecules, diagnostics or medical devices</li><li>Availability to travel up to 10% domestically and internationally</li><li>Availability to work non-standard business hours regularly due to the global nature of role</li> </ul> #PDP <br/><br/> #DS <br/><br/> #PDPNMA <br/><br/> <strong>Roche is an equal opportunity employer.</strong><br/><br/>Information Technology, Information Technology &gt; employer_description: About the job At Google, we put our users first. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Youll work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. Youll also work closely with customers and partner teams across Google, so strong collaboration skills are essential. Google is and always will be an engineering company. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. Work closely with customers and partner teams across Google. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Product management experience, with experience setting strategic direction and roadmaps in multi-stakeholder, and/or B2B or B2B2C spaces. About the job At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day. In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed. One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users. Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Work closely with customers and partner teams across Google. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Wer ist Hilti? Hilti steht für Innovation, Qualität und direkte Kundenbeziehungen. 93 % unserer Mitarbeiter sagen, dass sie stolz sind für Hilti zu arbeiten und nennen als Grund dafür die Qualität unserer Produkte und der Art, wie wir mit unseren Mitarbeitern umgehen. Erfolg basiert bei Hilti immer auf Teamarbeit und Kompetenz - egal, welchen Werdegang der Einzelne mitbringt. Bitte reichen Sie Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben, CV, Zeugnisse) ausschliesslich über unser Online-Karrieretool auf www.careers.hilti.ch ein. «Bei Hilti kann man Verantwortung übernehmen. Hilti ist ehrlich, bodenständig, knackig und erfrischend» Urs, Geschäftsführer Hilti Schweiz Sie suchen eine neue Herausforderung als Verkaufsinnendienstmitarbeiter/in? Sie verfügen über eine Persönlichkeit, die nicht nur beraten will, sondern gerne auch verkäuferisch aktiv sein möchte? Dann sind Sie bei uns richtig: Wir suchen Verstärkung für unser Kundendienstteam in Adliswil. Bei uns finden Sie allerdings keinen 0815 Job. Sie arbeiten mit Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus den unterschiedlichsten Erfahrungsbereichen zusammen, welche dieselben Interessen teilen: Eine aussergewöhnliche Bereitschaft, Neues zu lernen und zu teilen, eine Passion für innovative Lösungen und die Motivation, hervorragende Leistung zu zeigen. Wer ist Hilti? Wir entwickeln, fertigen und vertreiben hochmoderne Produkte, Technologien, Software und Dienstleistungen für die Bauindustrie. Wir können auf 75 Jahre Firmenerfahrung zurückblicken und unsere bahnbrechenden Produkte und unser außergewöhnlicher Service sind in der ganzen Welt bekannt. Mit 30.000 Beschäftigten in über 120 Ländern bieten wir Ihnen ein beeindruckendes Umfeld, in dem Sie sich beweisen, wachsen und Ihre Karriere selbst gestalten können. Was sind Ihre Aufgaben? Als Mitarbeiter/in im Kundenservice sind Sie das Aushängeschild unserer renommierten Marke. Wir bieten ein Premiumprodukt, von dem unsere Kunden einen entsprechend hohen Service erwarten. Bei jedem Kundenanliegen sind Sie ein kompetenter Ansprechpartner und sorgen stets für einen freundlichen und persönlichen telefonischen Kontakt. Sie beraten unsere Kunden und Außendienstmitarbeitenden telefonisch hinsichtlich Produkte-, Service- und anwendungstechnischen Fragen, nehmen Bestellungen entgegen, erstellen Offerten und bearbeiten Reklamationen. Sie zeigen Lösungsvorschläge bei technischen Anfragen auf und agieren als Koordinationsstelle zwischen den verschiedenen Verkaufskanälen und unseren internen Abteilungen. Was bieten wir? Neben einer attraktiven Entlohnung, guten Sozialleistungen und einer geregelten Arbeitszeit (Öffnungszeiten Kundendienst: Mo-Fr 07.00–17:30 Uhr) erwartet Sie außerdem eine einzigartige Unternehmenskultur, die es Ihnen ermöglicht, Ihre Ideen einzubringen. Warum suchen wir gerade Sie? Bei uns arbeiten hochqualifizierte Menschen, die aus den verschiedensten Bereichen kommen. Einige unserer besten Kundendienstmitarbeitenden haben noch nie im Kundendienst gearbeitet. Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt, bei einem der besten Arbeitgeber der Schweiz zu arbeiten? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung. Hilti ist ehrlich, bodenständig, knackig und erfrischend» Urs, Geschäftsführer Hilti Schweiz

Head of Social Media & Digital Manager Group Communications (GC) is responsible for creating a lasting positive image of Roche and are representing the company's voice on a Group level: We communicate Roches strategy and how we deliver on our purpose of Doing now what patients need next to Roche colleagues and external audiences. We contribute to building trust of key stakeholders, to managing Roches brand and reputation and to building a favorable environment for our business. Our communications claim is ambitious and simple: We inspire the world about Roches contribution to peoples health. In this role you will: Work with a self-organizing agile team of social media managers to oversee social media activities and accounts to ensure high-quality and high engaging content and user experience Collaborate and design social media strategies to improve engagement and ensure brand consistency across all our social media channels globally Actively drive the social media part of the integrated communications campaigns Innovate social media communications Drive strategy and implement paid social media that enables coordinated and efficient use of paid campaigns by Group Communications, and the larger organization; be primary point of contact with agencies implementing paid campaigns Enable access to our corporate channels and others in the company, help stakeholders get their content on social in the right place and right format Provide counsel to teammates, Group Communications and the wider organization on social media best practices Create and drive a ambassador program for Roche employees worldwide in collaboration with the head of employee communications Who you are: You have a university degree or comparable experience in communications as well as significant experience in strategic communications in a fast paced environment. employer_description: Position summary Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. Als Fachspezialist Tax arbeiten Sie in der Fachstelle Tax Compliance & Reporting, welche die Einhaltung der regulatorischen Vorgaben in den Bereichen AIA, FATCA, QI und anderen steuerrechtlichen Themengebieten sicherstellt. In Ihrer Funktion arbeiten Sie eng mit Business Engineers, Informatikern, dem Produktmanagement sowie Legal & Compliance zusammen und verstehen es, die unterschiedlichen Perspektiven in Abstimmung mit den Kolleg:innen aus der Fachstelle auf einen Nenner zu bringen. Le Credit Suisse vous offre l’environnement idéal pour faire avancer votre carrière, des avantages intéressants et une excellente formation. Nous sommes un gestionnaire de fortune de premier plan disposant de solides compétences de banque d’investissement à l’échelle mondiale. Notre fondation remonte à 1856. This team is a unified, aligned team working together in the pursuit of common goals and in service to our associates, to bring the One Novartis experience to life. The team works to ensure associates believe in, stand behind, and are proud of our Novartis strategy and culture, both inside and outside our walls. This role in particular is part of the Oncology Associate Engagement team (within the larger AE team) and tells the Novartis Oncology story and its BOLD 4 Cure strategy, helping to ensure Novartis is “the place to be” in oncology. The Senior Manager in this team is a strategic thinker and storyteller, and makes a direct contribution to the team’s Big Bold Objective of telling the Novartis Oncology story so that associates are empowered, competitors emulate us, health care professionals respect us and patients trust us. They feel passion to get there (there is no better place to live their purpose than Novartis). They become ambassadors (all encompassing) for Novartis Oncology. About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. At Swiss Re we combine experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise to create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. Swiss Re We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. The team is part of the Portfolio Management unit, and we collaborate with our direct insurance clients to deploy a professional suite of solutions for lapse reduction and improvement of policyholder engagement and customer experience. Effectively communicate relevant outcomes About you Demonstrated ability and experience in Customer Engagement and Experience management, ideally at a primary insurance or in insurance consulting Thorough understanding of L&H primary insurance along the whole value chain (ie Sales, Claims, Retention Management, Marketing) Ability to carry out analysis on large data set from several sources and generate valuable, impactful insights Good understanding of lapse drivers (ie arising from process, behavior or incentives) and of the EMEA insurance industry, of main products and services You possess good communication and presentation skills and are able to engage with all hierarchies across different business functions. The role will be preferably based either in Zurich or London. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Customer and Service Success Manager (gn) Location : Name Linked SoftwareONE, Leipzig, Germany Posted Date 12 hours ago(5/21/2021 6:41 PM) ID 2021-10470 Why SoftwareONE? SoftwareONE is a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions, headquartered in Switzerland. With around 7,800 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 90 countries, SoftwareONE provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers. You will have excellent skills at developing relationships which will allow you to understand the objectives and particular challenges of the customer organization to ensure they realize the full benefits of the MTWO solution and experience the highest levels of service and engagement with SoftwareONE. You will provide escalation management for Critical and Major customer Incidents and Service Requests keeping your customer up-to-date on resolution progress You will complete Root Cause Analysis of Critical and Major Incidents raised by the customer to optimize the experience for the customer and SoftwareONE. You will relay market needs and requirements back to internal SoftwareONE teams for future service and solution development You will mentor team members and assist them with their professional development You will provide input to account business plans to position SoftwareONE and MTWO appropriately You will provide thought leadership in highly complex projects/programs throughout the pre-sales and initial planning process You will possess a detailed understanding of the end-to-end onboarding process Through our internal training, you will be considered an expert on MTWO. Due to this new venture being a close partnership between SoftwareONE and RIB Software, your details may be shared between the two companies. You can read the data privacy statement of SoftwareONE here and RIB Software here. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful. What we expect from our employees Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. SoftwareONE is a leading global provider of end-to-end software and cloud technology solutions, headquartered in Switzerland. With around 7,800 employees and sales and service delivery capabilities in 90 countries, SoftwareONE provides around 65,000 business customers with software and cloud solutions from over 7,500 publishers. Strong together: In a strategic partnership with RIB Software, we will significantly influence the digital transformation of the architecture, construction and engineering industry with the help of a world-leading cloud solution. Help us as to drive the digitalisation of the world's largest industry as Customer and Service Success Manager (gn) location: Leipzig/Zwenkau (and surrounding area), available immediately, permanent contract, full-time. You will provide technical and systems management advisory services. What we need to see from you Ideally a technical degree in an AEC or IT related field of study Relevant experience in a service delivery/ customer management role Experience in managed cloud or ERP solutions delivery and implementation Ability to converse with senior customer stakeholders Desire to work in fast-paced, challenging environment Excellent communications skills with the ability to manage challenging conversations in a professional manner Listening to customers, probing for business process pains and opportunities, in an effort to meet or exceed their expectations Proven ability to influence others and lead customer engagements Strong ownership, bias for action and willingness to role-up your sleeves Detailed understanding of organizational structure, delivery requirements and services provided within practice domain of expertise What we have to offer A career within an innovative company with a unique corporate culture Top rating on glassdoor/kununu A company car of your choice The option to work from home A variety of training and development opportunities We trust you our working hours are flexible and not recorded! If yes, we are looking forward to receiving your compelling application documents, including information on your availability (starting date) and salary expectations. Please use our online form to apply. What you should really know about us. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. What we expect from our employees Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics. Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy. Share This Job

See job description for details Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. We are Credit Suisse. Credit Suisse offers you the ideal environment to progress your career, attractive benefits and excellent training. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Your field of responsibility We offer a challenging senior position within the First Line of Defense Support (FLDS) team, the inhouse center of competence in risk matters for the Private Banking markets of Russia, Israel, East-ern Europe and Central Asia. Your future colleagues We are a dynamic team of highly professional experts which values Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) and is committed to realizing the firm's D&I ambition which is an integral part of our global cultural values. We are looking for a motivated colleague with the fol-lowing skills set: • University degree or equivalent (preferably in the areas of business administration, econom-ics or law) • Track record of at least 5 years in Business Risk Management, Legal, Compliance, Consult-ing, Audit or in a front position within Private Banking • Sound experience in leading impactful projects, tackling complex issues and executing initia-tives in the context of a large organization • Ability to perform excellent stakeholder management and build and maintain trusted relation-ships at senior management level • Team player with strong analytical and conceptual skills combined a structured, solution ori-ented approach • Highly engaged and able to prioritize your own workload even while working under pressure • Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and to simplify complex issues to facilitate and expedite the decision making process • Fluency in written and spoken German and English • Finally, you understand the value of diversity in the workplace and is dedicated to fostering an inclusive culture in all aspects of working life so that people from all backgrounds receive equal treatment, realize their full potential and can bring their full, authentic selves to work. We are a leading wealth manager with strong global investment banking capabilities founded in 1856. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and with more than 45,000 employees from over 150 nations, we are always looking for motivated individuals to help us shape the future for our clients. Ein Haus der Luxusklasse, innen und aussen denkmalgeschützt, gehört es zu den architektonisch bedeutendsten Hotels der Alpen aus dem 19. Pontresina ist unweit vom mondänen St. Moritz, 1800 m ü.M. mitten in einer atemberaubenden Landschaft gelegen. Der Kronenhof gehört zu den führenden 5 Sterne Superior Häusern im Oberengadin und war GaultMillau-Hotel des Jahres. Unser Hotel erhielt unter anderem etliche der begehrten Travellers‘ Choice Awards des Onlineportals TripAdvisor und wurde zum besten Hotel der Welt ausgezeichnet. Ausserdem wurde uns von Schweiz Tourismus der Prix Bienvenu verliehen, der Award als gastfreundlichstes Luxushotel der Schweiz. Unser Hotel verfügt über 112 luxuriöse Suiten und Zimmer verschiedener Kategorien. Wir suchen ab der kommenden Wintersaison 2021/2022, d.h. ab ca. April 2022 und gerne auch für die weitere Zukunft einen kompetenten und motivierten Mitarbeiter zur Verstärkung unseres Bar-Teams.
industry: accommodation, hotel, restaurants and food service

| Microsoft continues to invest over $1B per year in cyber security and research, to provide its customers with the solutions to confidently move to the cloud and modernize their platforms by delivering the security and compliance solutions, expertise and services needed to keep their data safe. The Specialist Enterprise Security manages the relationship with the CISO and compliance decision makers in Microsoft’s top accounts, drives revenue and market share by providing customers with insights and solutions that help them confidently and securely move to the cloud. Work across Sales, Product, Marketing, Partner and Services organizations to pull together offerings that promote the goals of accelerating customer adoption of the Microsoft Cloud, leveraging advanced capabilities of Windows 10, EMS, Office 365 and Azure, and utilizing Microsoft’s and partner services for assessments, monitoring and detection, and incident response. Qualify prospects into opportunities by using consultative approaches to demonstrate how customers can enable digital transformation through cloud solutions, leveraging Microsoft Security and Compliance offerings. Determine the appropriate solution bringing together Microsoft team members as well as partners. Ensure opportunities are accurately qualified and mapped to customer budget cycle, aligned with Account Teams Orchestrate both Customer and Microsoft key resources in a virtual team environment to define solution vision and achieve desired business outcomes. Manage the overall Security opportunity deal governance working with the customer’s CISO / Security team and the Microsoft local Account and Specialist Teams. Solid understanding of Microsoft Cloud offerings and / or complementing solutions. The position requires the ability to articulate and present the business value of Microsoft's solutions and have a firm understanding of Microsoft's strategies, together with security and compliance offerings relative to major Microsoft competitors. The candidate must be confident and capable of delivering readiness to sales audiences and be able to represent the Cybersecurity solution sales business locally inside and outside of Microsoft, as well as be able to speak as a subject matter expert (SME) at industry or customer events Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required In the Security Solutions Area we are passionate about this mission and the Cybersecurity Sales team is looking for a motivated and self-driven sales professional to fill a key role as an Enterprise Security Executive (ESE). The Specialist Enterprise Security is a sales professional within our enterprise sales organization. Work across Sales, Product, Marketing, Partner and Services organizations to pull together offerings that promote the goals of accelerating customer adoption of the Microsoft Cloud, leveraging advanced capabilities of Windows 10, EMS, Office 365 and Azure, and utilizing Microsoft’s and partner services for assessments, monitoring and detection, and incident response. Lead security and compliance solution sales scenarios through understanding the customer’s long and short-term strategy, the industry, and the competition. Excellent knowledge of enterprise software security solutions and platform competitor landscape. Including specific knowledge in key security domains across the entire customer environment, like Identity and Access Management, Threat Protection, Information Protection. The candidate must be confident and capable of delivering readiness to sales audiences and be able to represent the Cybersecurity solution sales business locally inside and outside of Microsoft, as well as be able to speak as a subject matter expert (SME) at industry or customer events Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience required

Tu as la passion de la vente, du conseil clientèle et de l’aménagement intérieur  Tu aimes être en contact avec la clientèle et interagir avec eux d’une manière accueillante, attentionnée et inspirante   Tu prêtes une attention particulière aux besoins de la clientèle et fais de ton mieux pour lui proposer des solutions personnalisées et sur mesure   Tu souhaites contribuer activement au développement de tous les services disponibles dans le magasin pour aider notre clientèle à prendre de meilleures décisions et créer une expérience d’achat inoubliable   Tu établis des priorités et organises ton travail quotidien de manière efficace afin d’utiliser au mieux ton temps  Tu es disponible es as envie de travailler le jeudi ou vendredi soir (17:00-21:00) et tous les samedis  Tu as de bonnes compétences informatiques, tu parles couramment le français et tu possèdes également une bonne connaissance de l’anglais    TES RESPONSABILITÉS      Contribuer à créer une expérience d’achat extraordinaire chez IKEA et garantir la satisfaction de la clientèle   Approcher activement les clientes et clients afin d'identifier leurs besoins et les conseiller sur les meilleures solutions  Connaître et offrir aux clientes et clients la gamme complète des services disponibles en fonction de leurs besoins   Maximiser les ventes en veillant à ce que ta zone de responsabilité soit toujours propre, rangée et bien approvisionnée    A PROPOS DE CE SECTEUR D'ACTIVITÉ    Nous sommes celles et ceux qui rencontrent nos clientes et clients, dans nos magasins, en ligne, dans notre catalogue et ailleurs. Nous avons une bonne connaissance de l'assortiment IKEA, des marchés nationaux et des besoins de la clientèle et nous cherchons constamment de nouvelles façons de créer de vrais liens avec nos clientes et clients afin de maximiser les ventes et la rentabilité. Avec nos milliers de collègues à travers le monde, nous collaborons pour assurer la continuité du concept IKEA, afin de permettre à des millions de gens d'améliorer leur quotidien! Après une première sélection, les candidates et candidats retenus seront invités à un entretien téléphonique ou vidéo. Après cette étape, nous inviterons les personnes sélectionnées à un entretien face à face avec le ou la responsable hiérarchique et éventuellement d'autres intervenants. Take the next step in your career at ABB, working in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. . Our mission Human Resources (HR) is to help ABB stand out when it comes to our people - from leadership, performance and talent management to rewards and career opportunity. You will be responsible taking care for HR master data domain with focus on strategic aspects, including owning ABB’s job architecture. You will be working closely with business regarding the impact of strategy, organization, processes, compensation and reporting on ABB’s master data model and will have overall globally accountable for HR master data governance, design, maintenance and implementation. You will also be responsible for the designing of ABB’s HR Master Data (MD) model in the context of globally implementing Workday for HR reflecting the ABB Way with fully revised job architecture and skills matrix. Your Responsibilities Owning and driving the maintenance of ABB’s HR MD Rulebook and of ABB’s job architecture for meeting the needs of the ABB Way based on the foundation defined by HRGT (2020/2021) and Workday’s HR data model (2022+). Functionally leading colleagues working on HR MD across ABB including development and operations and ensure that the area of responsibility is effectively organized, staffed, skilled and directed. Living ABB’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. HQ Talent Acquisition Team ABB Asea Brown Boveri Ltd Let’s write the future. www.abb.com/careers We reserve the right to withdraw this posting at any time GBS HR Excellence In all that we do, we seek to create competitive advantage by dedicating resources to attracting, developing and retaining talented individuals who are customer-focused, collaborative, innovative and driven. You will be working closely with business regarding the impact of strategy, organization, processes, compensation and reporting on ABB’s master data model and will have overall globally accountable for HR master data governance, design, maintenance and implementation. Your background Graduate/post-graduate degree in Business, Management, HR, Computer Science or related discipline. 10+ years of experience in HR Information Systems management and/or HR Master Data related roles employed by large technological and industrial organizations, used to deal with fast moving environment, complex matrix organization and cross-cultural management. Hands-on experience with HRIS solutions like SAP-HCM, Workday or others and familiarity with HR end to end processes. Experienced in data quality management processes (5C, lean management concepts), previous usage of advanced data quality software is highly preferred.

Willi Staubli Head Gruppen-Aktuariat Leben Arbeiten bei Helvetia Wir bei Helvetia suchen Menschen mit Ecken und Kanten. Dieses Vertrauen schenken wir all unseren Mitarbeitenden und genau das macht Arbeiten bei Helvetia auch so besonders. Helvetia Es steht für das Vertrauen, das wir in unsere Mitarbeitenden und deren Fähigkeiten setzen. Denn wir sind überzeugt, dass ein gemeinsamer Erfolg nur möglich ist, wenn jeder den nötigen Freiraum bekommt, Talente bestmöglich einzusetzen. Das bringt nicht nur Dich persönlich weiter, sondern das gesamte Unternehmen. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung! Echte Persönlichkeiten, die mit Herz bei der Sache sind, mutig vorangehen und nicht davor zurückschrecken mal auf Gegenwind zu stoßen. Denn nur wer Neues ausprobiert und daraus lernt, bringt sich selbst und das gesamte Unternehmen weiter. Dieses Vertrauen schenken wir all unseren Mitarbeitenden und genau das macht Arbeiten bei Helvetia auch so besonders.

The role: The SAP Solution Specialist is responsible for driving and co-owning SAP solution sales, business development, and marketing activities within his/her assigned region. The SAP Solution Specialist is the technical lead in the region for pre-sales customer engagements and sales enablement for the respective region. The key platform partners are Microsoft with its Azure offering as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS). The SAP TS practice delivers the services to customers through a network of experts both in-country, near-shore and offshore who are highly skilled and experienced experts following the principles of continues learning. Roles & Responsibilities: Sales & Services Partners and co-owns sales activities at a customer level with the field-based account manager (Business Development Manager [BDM]). by studying blueprints, plans, and related customer documents; consulting with other engineers, architects, practice leads and other professional and technical personnel (both internal and external). Partner with stakeholders and drive solution marketing activities by preparing and delivering content and messaging. Technical pre-sales. Team leadership. Advanced-level Partner Sales and Technical Certifications required.

In particular, you are: working towards or have recently completed your Bachelor's degree in e.g. journalism, communications or public relations, or working towards your Master's degree a fluent English or German speaker with advanced knowledge in the other language an expert writer with an eye for detail (spotting typos is your second nature) a self-starter, innovative person experienced in social media excellent at organizing and coordinating events a team player who's able to work independently happy to work to tight and changing deadlines proficient in Microsoft Office suite of products It would be great if you have: an interest in financial services graphic design and video editing skills Perhaps youve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? WER DU BIST Im Bereich IKEA Food gibst du dein bestes um den Kundinnen und Kunden ein einzigartiges Einkaufserlebnis zu ermöglichen und gleichzeitig unwiderstehliche Speisenangebote in einer einladenden Atmosphäre anzubieten, die ihnen einen guten Grund zum Wiederkommen geben. Du verfügst über Führungsqualitäten und bist motiviert, mit IKEA zu wachsen und in der Zukunft ein Team zu leiten. Ob im IKEA Restaurant, Schwedenshop, Bistro oder Mitarbeiterrestaurant: Du gehst aktiv auf deine Kundschaft zu und begegnest ihr immer mit einer grossen Portion Gastfreundschaft. Du trägst zum Geschäftsplan des Einrichtungshauses und IKEA Food bei und hilfst, diese Ziele umzusetzen. Gemeinsam mit deinen Vorgesetzten initiierst und ergreifst du Massnahmen zur Umsatzsteigerung und für ein noch besseres Kundenerlebnis im Bereich IKEA Food. In den IKEA Restaurants bedienen wir zusammen jährlich über 660 Millionen Kunden weltweit. Auch in unseren Bistros und den IKEA Schwedenshops bieten wir eine reiche Vielfalt an Lebensmitteln. Unser bunt gemischtes IKEA Food Team lebt und arbeitet nach dem Motto: Das Lachen klingt dort am hellsten, wo es etwas zu essen gibt! Du hast idealerweise Erfahrung in der Systemgastronomie / im Gastgewerbe oder im Einzelhandel und den Wunsch, dich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln. Du hast Spass am Verkauf und im Kundenkontakt. Dir liegt die Arbeit in einem lebendigen und abwechslungsreichen Umfeld in einem grossen Team. Du bist hoch motiviert und engagiert und kannst dich schnell in neue Themen einarbeiten. Du arbeitest strukturiert und gut organisiert. Ob du mit Gästen oder Kolleginnen und Kollegen im Einrichtungshaus kommunizierst – du findest immer den richtigen Ton. Du sprichst fliessend Deutsch (B2) und hast mindestens Englisch-Grundkenntnisse (B2) Du bist flexibel und verstehst, dass sich deine Arbeitszeiten nach den Öffnungszeiten richten. Du verfügst idealerweise über Computerkenntnisse, insbesondere in MS Office. Dein Ziel ist es, unseren Kundinnen und Kunden durch ein unwiderstehliches Produktangebot und eine einladende Atmosphäre einen guten Grund zu geben immer wieder zu kommen. Ob im IKEA Restaurant, Schwedenshop, Bistro oder Mitarbeiterrestaurant: Du gehst aktiv auf deine Kundschaft zu und begegnest ihr immer mit einer grossen Portion Gastfreundschaft. Unsere Produkte zeigen sich in einem einwandfreien Zustand und sind stets korrekt ausgezeichnet. Die Lebensmittel, die wir servieren und verkaufen, begeistern dich. Du eignest dir aktiv Wissen an und teilst es mit Kundinnen und Kunden, sowie mit Kolleginnen und Kollegen. Du bist kreativ, wenn es um neue Ideen geht, die unsere Gäste inspirieren und positiv überraschen. ÜBER DIESEN ARBEITSBEREICH Auch durch Lebensmittel, die gut für Mensch und Erde sind, möchten wir einen besseren Alltag für unsere Kundinnen und Kunden schaffen. In den IKEA Restaurants bedienen wir zusammen jährlich über 660 Millionen Kunden weltweit. Unsere typisch schwedischen Spezialitäten unterstreichen dabei unsere skandinavische Herkunft in der ganzen Welt. Auch in unseren Bistros und den IKEA Schwedenshops bieten wir eine reiche Vielfalt an Lebensmitteln. Unser bunt gemischtes IKEA Food Team lebt und arbeitet nach dem Motto: Das Lachen klingt dort am hellsten, wo es etwas zu essen gibt! Nach einer ersten Auswahl werden erfolgreiche Bewerbende zu einem Telefon- oder Videointerview eingeladen. Aufgrund dessen erfolgt eine zweite Auswahl nach der wir die ausgewählten Bewerbenden zu einem persönlichen Gespräch mit dem Manager und möglicherweise anderen Beteiligten einladen. Wir prüfen die Bewerbungen laufend und werden diese Stelle schliessen, sobald wir die richtige Kandidatin oder den richtigen Kandidaten gefunden haben. Auf dieser Stelle ist es wichtig, dass du in Bezug auf die Arbeitszeiten (07:00- 22:00 Uhr) flexibel bist. About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the world's leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. You will be responsible for learning and development globally ensuring this is aligned to Swiss Re's strategy and business priorities. At Swiss Re we like to celebrate our achievements, and we have won many awards for our progressive learning approaches and you will have the opportunity to share and apply your passion to push the boundaries further. The team is located across several major Swiss Re offices globally and is often embedded into broader working groups in OPD, regularly working as part of agile teams on major deliverables. You are likely to demonstrate many of the following characteristics: Excellent understanding of and experience in 'new ways of learning' outside of traditional learning methodologies and approaches Sound understanding of progressive learning trends, digital solutions and technology supporting and driving learning Very open minded towards new approaches and ways of working Analytical mind who is digital savvy and understands how to achieve results through applying best in class digital solutions and technology Commercially focused and able to translate business strategy into relevant learning and development interventions well connected to wider HR solutions Ability to influence at a senior level in the organisation supported by excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills Great leadership and interpersonal skills in order to develop talent and to motivate colleagues across the globe to deliver at their best Learning agility is necessary to quickly understand the business which means specific insurance industry experience is not required Likely to have Master's degree level or higher professional qualifications in any subject connected to People and Development disciplines Swiss Re is an equal opportunity employer. Keywords: Reference Code: 108869 Swiss Re We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. Join our team as Head of Learning & Development The Head of Learning & Development is a senior position in our Organisation & People Development (OPD) function. We are one of three Centres of Excellence within Human Resources. As our new colleague you will lead a team of talented professionals and will be a member of the OPD Leadership team. Since we are a knowledge company, employee development is a fundamental part of our philosophy and strategy as it contributes significantly to the success of the firm. You and your team will also work closely with the business on technical capabilities where these relate to major initiatives or transformations. You will partner with a wide stakeholder group including colleagues, for example in HR, the Business Units and IT. About the Team The team is diverse, loves to have fun and be creative. We are looking for a true team player who enjoys and is successful collaborating in our well networked company. It is our practice to recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, pregnancy, sexual orientations, marital status, military status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Decisions on employment are solely based on an individual's qualifications for the position being filled.

hedge accounting and provide documentation FX and Pension Fund Controlling Monitor interest rate and foreign currency risk You will provide controlling and reporting for the Swiss Pension Fund as well allocation, rules, investment policies and strategies Cash Management Act as contact person for all cash management related requests for the Swiss pension fund Take responsibility for liquidity analytical skills, drive to be a constant challenger to the team Proficient use of SAP apllications including TRM, MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint and a sound knowledge of Power BI You’ll work closely with teams on the production side of Google to further streamline and automate the end-to-end production journey for developers and embed well-lit paths that improve reliability and simplify Google-class server development. employer_description: SIX ist eine Arbeitgeberin mit Chancengleichheit. Das sind deine Aufgaben Selbstständige Entwicklung von SIX übergreifenden IT-Prozessen und Rollen unter Einbezug aller relevanten Aspekte und Stakeholder Ausarbeiten von Governance Dokumenten und Standards Mitarbeit bei der Erweiterung des Enterprise Architecture Repositorien (konzeptionell aber auch gerne technische und inhaltliche Umsetzungen) Zusammenarbeit mit Business-, Applikations-, Domänen-, Security- und Technischen-Architekten, sowie Mitarbeitern aller IT-Disziplinen und Führungsstufen Aufbereiten von Entscheidungsgrundlagen wie Business- und Prozess-Modellen, Enterprise Roadmaps, technischen Konzepten, komplexe Architekturen. SIX ist eine Arbeitgeberin mit Chancengleichheit. Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten. Als Mitarbeiter der Einheit "Enterprise Architecture" (Business Unit «CIT-R») wirst du innerhalb eines kleinen dynamischen Teams konzernweite IT-Prozesse und die entsprechende IT-Governance gestalten. Das bringst du mit Master in Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik, sowie umfangreiche Erfahrung im Bereich IT in breit gefächerten Teilgebieten und Rollen Interdisziplinäre Fragestellungen verstehen und strukturiert aufbereiten sowie Erfahrung in der Kommunikation von (Architektur-) Modellen in den unterschiedlichsten Gremien auf verschiedenen Hierarchiestufen.

The Early Clinical Development Oncology (ECDO) group within Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) translates world-class science into medical innovation through a diversity of technologies and talents located across three research centers worldwide (Innovation Centers Basel, Munich, and Zurich). We want someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. Our Mission is to transform pioneering scientific discoveries into effective medicines. The Medical Director (MD) is a core member of the Early Clinical Development Oncology organization. He / She is the key medical expert on the Project Team and leads the Clinical Expert Team. proposes, establishes and leads external collaborations leads the Clinical Expert Team consisting of different functions supporting early clinical development confidently interprets and presents preclinical and clinical data to internal and external stakeholders assures GCP, Clinical Operating Guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures are followed, is responsible for safety management manages one or several clinical scientists Who You Are Youre someone who wants to influence your own development. We are looking for these qualifications: As the ideal candidate, you bring solid experience in clinical oncology and/or hematology and overall knowledge of the broad research and drug development process in oncology. You are medically qualified (MD), ideally combined with a PhD. Additionally, you have the following skills/ expertise: Patient-related clinical experience as investigator on Phase I/II studies Industry experience (minimum 2-3 years) preferred, You enjoy thinking strategically beyond current standard of care and at the same time able to work hands on, You have a positive mindset and a deep understanding of the challenges and uncertainty of early medical research, You are proactive, have a very flexible attitude, and you can adapt easily to change, You work as experienced matrix leader and decision maker with strong leadership skills to influence and motivate Teams, You have an understanding of contemporary translational research tools, including imaging, biomarkers and an understanding of unmet medical needs in oncology and ability to think beyond current paradigms of care, Are you ready to apply? We want someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Ikea German WER DU BIST Candidate profile (text) Wir suchen aufgeschlossene Verkaufsmitarbeitende, die unsere Kundinnen und Kunden nicht nur freundlich und kompetent beraten, sondern denen es ein Anliegen ist ihnen ein aussergewöhnliches Einkaufserlebnis zu bieten. Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Vertrieb oder im Kundenservice. Kennen der gesamten Palette verfügbarer Dienstleistungen um diese unseren Kundinnen und Kunden anzubieten. Team vision and mission (title) German ÜBER DIESEN ARBEITSBEREICH Team vision and mission (text) Wir sind diejenigen, die unseren Kundinnen und Kunden begegnen - in unseren Einrichtungshäusern, online, im Katalog und darüber hinaus. Wir kennen die Kundenbedürfnisse, unser Produktsortiment, die lokalen Märkte und finden neue Wege, eine echte Verbindung zu unseren Kundinnen und Kunden zu haben. Zusammen mit Tausenden Kolleginnen und Kollegen weltweit sind wir ein vielfältiges Team, das am kontinuierlichen globalen Erfolg des IKEA Konzepts arbeitet - ein Konzept, dass Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden beider Gestaltung eines besseren Alltags unterstützt! Nach einer ersten Auswahl werden erfolgreiche Bewerbende zu einem Telefon- oder Videointerview eingeladen. Aufgrund dessen erfolgt eine zweite Auswahl nach der wir die ausgewählten Bewerbenden zu einem persönlichen Gespräch mit den Manager und möglicherweise anderen Beteiligten einladen. Wir prüfen die Bewerbungen laufend und werden diese Stelle schliessen, sobald wir die richtige Kandidatin oder den richtigen Kandidaten gefunden haben. Auf dieser Stelle ist es wichtig, dass du in Bezug auf die Arbeitszeiten flexibel bist. Früh- oder Spätschichten im Rahmen unserer Öffnungszeiten sowie Samstagseinsätze sollten für dich selbstverständlich sein. WARUM DU UNS MÖGEN WIRST Aus den tiefen Wäldern Schwedens haben wir unsere Kultur und unsere Werte bis in die ganze Welt verbreitet. Im Zentrum unseres Angebots stehen unsere wunderschönen Heimeinrichtungsprodukte und -lösungen, die umweltschonend hergestellt wurden und Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden erreichen. Im Zentrum unseres Geschäfts stehen unsere wunderbaren Mitarbeitenden, die Vielfalt in allen Bereichen und Leidenschaft für das Leben zuhause repräsentieren. Wir alle bringen unsere Einzigartigkeit ein und möchten gemeinsam wachsen und uns weiterentwickeln. Unsere Vision, "den vielen Menschen einen besseren Alltag schaffen", inspiriert und leitet uns bei unserem gesamten Handeln. Das ist IKEA. WAS WIR ALLE GEMEINSAM HABEN Unsere Werte leben Du selbst sein und zugleich andere achten und integrieren Leidenschaft für Heimeinrichtung Performen & liefern beim Lernen & Entwickeln Spaß haben!

Description du poste Coop hat den Anspruch, die beste und kundennächste Detailhändlerin in der Schweiz zu sein. Dann sind genau Sie die richtige Person für unser Team. Sie bedienen und beraten unsere anspruchsvolle Kundschaft in den diversen Rayons. Unter Einhaltung unserer Qualitäts- und POS-Richtlinien (Frische/Qualität, Hygiene, Temperaturvorschriften, Verfalldaten) bewirtschaften Sie die Waren und setzen die Verkaufsförderungsmassnahmen um.

Die Credit Suisse bietet Ihnen das ideale Umfeld für die Karriereentwicklung sowie attraktive Personalnebenleistungen und erstklassige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten. Die Credit Suisse wurde 1856 gegründet und beschäftigt mehr als 45’000 Mitarbeitende aus über 150 verschiedenen Nationen. Die Credit Suisse fördert Chancengleichheit. Ihr Aufgabenbereich Sie erhalten die Möglichkeit ein off-shore Kundendossier mit Swiss Nationals zu übernehmen. Ihre zukünftigen Kunden betreuen Sie anhand einer klar definierten Angebots- und Produktepalette. Fachliche Unterstützung durch unsere Spezialistinnen und –Spezialisten ist Ihnen sicher, sowie eine gezielte Einführung ins Tätigkeitsgebiet durch unser Onboarding Programm. Ihre zukünftigen Kolleginnen und Kollegen Werden Sie Teil einer teamorientierten, dynamischen und zukunftsgerichteten Organisation, in welcher Sie die Möglichkeit haben, sich persönlich und auch beruflich entwickeln zu können. Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) ist für unser Departement von grosser Bedeutung und wir sind bestrebt, die D&I-Ambitionen des Unternehmens, die ein wesentlicher Bestandteil unserer kulturellen Werte sind, umzusetzen. Wir sind ein weltweit führender Vermögensverwalter mit starken Kompetenzen im Investment Banking und Hauptsitz in Zürich in der Schweiz. Die Credit Suisse wurde 1856 gegründet und beschäftigt mehr als 45’000 Mitarbeitende aus über 150 verschiedenen Nationen. Wir sind stets auf der Suche nach motivierten Mitarbeitenden, die die Zukunft unserer Kundinnen und Kunden mitgestalten möchten.
Im Sommer sind wir der ideale Ausgangspunkt für Wanderungen. Im Winter führen zwei Skipisten bis vor unser Haus.

employer_description: People make Deloitte one of the best places to work, to learn, to grow. About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312’000 people in 150 countries and territories. Our International group portfolio of clients include some the largest and most successful of the businesses that Deloitte work with in Switzerland. Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a broad internal and external training programAs one of the largest audit and assurance practices, joining us will mean working with some of the leading practitioners in the industry, for some of the leading organizations in the world and towards a career goal that is entirely yours to shape. Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any questions, please contact Simone Terlizzi at talent@deloitte.ch Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312’000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Our Audit team is looking for you! Our Corporate Audit and Assurance business has recently undergone an exciting transformation in which we will be able to provide the highest quality, client specific audit and advisory services to our clients. Our International group portfolio of clients include some the largest and most successful of the businesses that Deloitte work with in Switzerland. This work is for those who respond well to the challenge of understanding a client’s business and key controls. We understand an audit is not about looking back, but about helping those businesses to plan for a successful future. Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a broad internal and external training programAs one of the largest audit and assurance practices, joining us will mean working with some of the leading practitioners in the industry, for some of the leading organizations in the world and towards a career goal that is entirely yours to shape. Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom.

outstanding individuals work at Novartis all with different needs and aspirations. In this role you will be responsible for the income tax returns of all Novartis Swiss entities as well as other Swiss related tax national or international forms. Operate as advisory for Swiss tax compliance matters, including M&A, restructuring and projects Your remit will be: Monitor national tax environment and align with local stakeholders to drive quality and ensure compliance with local tax laws, advise Group Tax Team on tax developments having an impact on compliance and disclosures Maintain and govern a good working relationship with tax authorities at cantonal and federal level Represent Swiss Tax vis a vis Swiss based business units and functions in the area of Swiss tax compliance Coordinate and align tax compliance matters with the respective stakeholders at HQ/Country level (such as Funds Flow, FRA, CFO, FSC, business unit, HR, Group Treasury...) Coordinate and review the tax calculations for Novartis Swiss entities Supervise the preparation and filing of income tax returns including alignment of positions with Group Tax and other stakeholders Determine and monitor tax payments, align with stakeholders (Finance, Treasury) Monitor the Swiss group internal movements from a TP perspective and align with the Group Tax TP Lead the discussion with the Swiss tax authorities in the framework of inquiries, audit, litigation Ensure at all times the bridging between IFRS, Statutory, Tax accounts, in all dimensions of P/L vs B/S, cash vs accounting and time dimension Responsible for the SOX filings in the area of Swiss Tax compliance Support Group Tax in the framework of Novartis disclosures (e.g .DAC-6, CbCR, OECD Pillar I and II, etc.) Monitor activities potentially impacting Swiss tax filings, including M&A, BD&, restructurings Act as an adviser to Group Tax, Finance and Business with respect to the opportunity, form and content of position papers Support the Swiss Tax Risk planning on all dimensions including Uncertain Tax Position (UTP) provisioning for Swiss matters and for global matters potentially having an impact on HQ Supports Group Tax and operations with financial data and information, including past events, available from Swiss tax compliance Assess intercompany relationships and guide Global Business Units to ensure compliance Review of business development deals, structuring/restructuring projects aligned with Group Tax and the Group tax strategy and assess impact on filings Support Swiss Planning when engaging with the tax authorities on planning opportunities, implemention of rulings Description du profil University degree or equivalent in Tax or Legal or Finance or Economics required - Additional qualification in a Tax or Finance related area (Tax Expert, Tax Lawyer, CTA) - Specific Tax Expertise relating to Switzerland - 5 - 7 years of tax practice: in big 4 firm (or equivalent), leaving as Manager/Senior Manager (experience as in-house tax manager a bonus) - German language skills essential - The ability to communicate English language skills also a must COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY & INCLUSION: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network WHY NOVARTIS? 769 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2020, and while we're proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people's lives. Imagine what you could do here at Novartis! Acts as deputy of the Swiss Head of Tax for Swiss Tax compliance matters and represent Swiss Tax with local and global stakeholders for and Group Tax disclosure. Monitor activities potentially impacting Swiss tax filings, including M&A, BD&, restructurings Act as an adviser to Group Tax, Finance and Business with respect to the opportunity, form and content of position papers Support the Swiss Tax Risk planning on all dimensions including Uncertain Tax Position (UTP) provisioning for Swiss matters and for global matters potentially having an impact on HQ Supports Group Tax and operations with financial data and information, including past events, available from Swiss tax compliance Assess intercompany relationships and guide Global Business Units to ensure compliance Review of business development deals, structuring/restructuring projects aligned with Group Tax and the Group tax strategy and assess impact on filings Support Swiss Planning when engaging with the tax authorities on planning opportunities, implemention of rulings Description du profil University degree or equivalent in Tax or Legal or Finance or Economics required - Additional qualification in a Tax or Finance related area (Tax Expert, Tax Lawyer, CTA) - Specific Tax Expertise relating to Switzerland - 5 - 7 years of tax practice: in big 4 firm (or equivalent), leaving as Manager/Senior Manager (experience as in-house tax manager a bonus) - German language skills essential - The ability to communicate English language skills also a must COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY & INCLUSION: Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion.

Unser Team ist zentrales Bindeglied zwischen den internen Bereichen, Projektleitern, Kunden, Fachvertretern sowie Lieferanten. Dein Wirkungsfeld - Du arbeitest in einem abwechslungsreichen Aufgabengebiet, welches die Betreuung sowie die Weiterentwicklung von Lösungen umfasst. - Zu deinen Kernaufgaben gehören die technische Koordination, Anwenderschulungen, das Applikationsmanagement sowie das Wartungsmanagement. - Du arbeitest schweizweit eng mit Partnern zusammen und begleitest diese in technischen und fachlichen Fragen. - Mit deinem Informatikwissen rund um Serversysteme, Netzwerke sowie Applikationen verstehst du die Spezialisten und kannst mit ihnen auf Augenhöhe anstehende Herausforderungen diskutieren. - Die strategische Weiterentwicklung der Systemlandschaft gehört ebenfalls zu deinem Aufgabengebiet, wie auch die Unterstützung der Qualitätsverantwortlichen bei der Durchführung von Systemtests. Dein Profil - Eine Ausbildung in der Informatik, eine Weiterbildung in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine gleichwertige Ausbildung bilden die Basis deiner Laufbahn. - Weiter verfügst du über Erfahrung im Application Management und bist bereit unsere Kunden in der Schweiz vor Ort zu unterstützen sowie Pikettdienste zu leisten.

Wer ist Hilti? Hilti steht für Innovation, Qualität und direkte Kundenbeziehungen. Dabei demonstrieren Sie nicht nur vor Ort einige der innovativsten Produkte der Branche, sondern Sie vermarkten hochmoderne Software sowie alle Hilti-Services. 93 % unserer Mitarbeitenden sagen, dass sie stolz sind für Hilti zu arbeiten und nennen als Grund dafür die Qualität unserer Produkte und die Art, wie wir miteinander umgehen. | Wen suchen wir? Sie teilen unsere Passion für den Direktvertrieb? Kommen Sie ursprünglich aus dem Appenzellerland oder Toggenburg? Dann suchen wir genau Sie, eine aussergewöhnliche Verkaufspersönlichkeit! Wer ist Hilti? Wir entwickeln, fertigen und vertreiben hochmoderne Produkte, Technologien, Software und Dienstleistungen für die Bauindustrie. Wir können auf 75 Jahre Firmenerfahrung zurückblicken und unsere bahnbrechenden Produkte und unser außergewöhnlicher Service sind in der ganzen Welt bekannt. Mit 30.000 Beschäftigten in über 120 Ländern bieten wir Ihnen ein beeindruckendes Umfeld, in dem Sie sich beweisen, wachsen und Ihre Karriere selbst gestalten können. Was sind Ihre Aufgaben? Als Verkaufsberater / in im Aussendienst sind Sie täglich bei unseren Kunden und begeistern diese an Ihren jeweiligen Einsatzorten auf der Baustelle, in Werkstätten oder Büros. 93 % unserer Mitarbeitenden sagen, dass sie stolz sind für Hilti zu arbeiten und nennen als Grund dafür die Qualität unserer Produkte und die Art, wie wir miteinander umgehen. Was bieten wir? Dazu gehören ein dreiwöchiges Basistraining, kontinuierliche Schulungen, Mitarbeiterentwicklung und viel Verantwortung und Freiraum von Anfang an. Unser Betriebsklima ist geprägt durch persönliche Leistung, Teamwork und Unterstützung. Warum suchen wir gerade Sie?

Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. And thats the kind of work we want to be part of. Description Apples AI/ML residency is a year long program inviting experts in various fields to apply their own domain expertise to build revolutionary machine learning and AI empowered products and experiences. Apple AI/ML residents will be matched with a machine learning research/engineering mentor, and will contribute to their teams research, product design, and development. Combining groundbreaking machine learning techniques with next-generation hardware, our teams take user experiences to the next level. Ideal candidates will also have experience in one of the following: HCI/design, linguistics, neuroscience, medicine, public health, biology, information retrieval, computer graphics, robotics, autonomous systems, applied math/statistics, physics, systems engineering, electrical engineering, sensors/signal processing, databases, distributed systems, data mining, econometrics, cognitive science, and psychology. Thesis, capstone project, internship, co-op, and/or industry experience in these fields will qualify. Education & Experience Graduate degree in a STEM field or equivalent industry experience in software engineering.

employer_description: | About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312'000 people in 150 countries and territories. Cyber Risk Services at Deloitte In a rapidly changing world where information is the new currency, the corresponding information security and privacy have become a board level challenge. Deloitte has the largest Cyber capability of the Big 4 in the European marketplace with over 600 Cyber Risk Specialists staffing thousands of client engagements. What you'll do As a Business Continuity Management (BCM) Consultant, you will be part of the team's SME group on Business Continuity Management; You will utilise your subject-matter expertise in delivering challenging projects to our client base, aiming to improve maturity in the field of BCM / Disaster Recovery / Operational Resilience You will partake in Business Development activities, enhancing our BCM proposition and identifying new clients; You will act as point of contact for other Deloitte firms on cross-border projects; You may consult internal Deloitte security teams on BCM process enhancements based on your project expertise What you need Strong interpersonal skills as well as the proven ability to develop long-lasting relationships, influence others, and negotiate agreements are expected. If you have any question, please contact Rebecca Hodge at talent deloitte.ch . Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Cyber Risk Services at Deloitte In a rapidly changing world where information is the new currency, the corresponding information security and privacy have become a board level challenge. In addition, you can drill deep and become a specialist within an industry sector or grow as a generalist. You will have a Big 4 Cyber consulting background, or equivalent experience delivering significant change in complex organizational environments with demanding stakeholders. Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal by clicking on the apply button . Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom.

employer_description: Basic Info Location Zrich, Generic, Global Job type Full-Time Contract Regular/Permanent Take the next step in your career at ABB, working in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy. As the Senior Group Technical Accounting & Reporting (A&R) Manager you will be reporting to the Head of Technical Accounting of the ABB Group, headquartered in Switzerland. You will ensure a true and fair view of financial data provided to all stakeholders of ABB in compliance with the ABB Accounting & Reporting Guidelines based on U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) as well as other relevant instructions including regulations of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Your responsibilities Responsible for operational execution and processes of the ABB Group, including definition of the standards and policies for A&R, validation and processing of subsidiaries inputs and preparation of Group public reports. Living ABBs core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business. Ability to be diplomatic and yet persistent in the resolution of identified deviations from ABB Accounting & Reporting Guidelines. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. HQ Talent Acquisition Team ABB Asea Brown Boveri Ltd Lets write the future. Your responsibilities Responsible for operational execution and processes of the ABB Group, including definition of the standards and policies for A&R, validation and processing of subsidiaries inputs and preparation of Group public reports. revenue recognition, leasing and provisions for industrial companies. Designing and maintaining internal controls over financial reporting and performing control activities in the respective area of responsibility in compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley requirements. Your background Masters level degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration. U.S. Certified Public Accountant (CPA) coupled with a minimum of ten years of experience in technical accounting and financial reporting according to US GAAP and SEC standards, preferably with a renowned public accounting firm (big four). International work experience obtained in a multinational company in the industrial sector.

employer_description: Our funds are designed to reflect the Credit Suisse House View in client portfolios, with a balanced mix of IS&P internal investment capabilities and co-created funds with market leading capabilities from 3rd party asset managers, with a strong product shelf focus on ESG/ Sustainable Solutions. Our funds are designed to reflect the Credit Suisse House View in client portfolios, with a balanced mix of IS&P internal investment capabilities and co-created funds with market leading capabilities from 3rd party asset managers, with a strong product shelf focus on ESG/ Sustainable Solutions. Focus on Zurich based activities, with targeted travels across Switzerland and international offices Ability to independently expand the breadth of a well-established network, with partners ranging from Investment Management/ Discretionary mandates, Private Banking Delivery, Advisory & Sales and Investment Consulting teams, as well as select interactions with institutional sales channels and covering large single client cases Close interaction and cooperation across a diverse set of subject matter experts, including fund structuring/ product development, portfolio management, ESG/Impact/ Sustainable experts, Global Fund Selection team and Investment Strategy & Research team Opportunity to actively identify and co-shape future fund solutions, by condensing business partners and market feedback into new commercial propositions to be sounded with the structuring team Ability to leverage and expand existing relationships with 3rd party asset management partners, providing insights into market developments beyond immediate fund platform From the beginning, you will have one team member reporting into you, with a midterm ambition to further scale the team Ideally 8-12 years of work experience with relevant academic background preferred Commercial/Proposition development experience in a B2B environment Previous experience in UCITS funds landscape preferred Proven ability to generate sales impact through a structured and replicable, yet interpersonal and relationship focused approach You have a strategic, yet hands on approach.

WHO YOU ARE As Service Fulfilment Operations Specialist, you will be part of the Customer Fulfilment (CFF) Team, which is a fundamental part in making IKEA multichannel retailing a reality. To support IKEA in achieving business objectives, CFF acts as a fully integrated, process-oriented organisation with an end-to-end approach to develop our business and deliver results across functions together with our partners. ABOUT THIS WORK AREA Were the team behind the scenes that make the IKEA products available to the many people. Were passionate about working together to improve the customer experience at IKEA! WHO YOU ARE As Service Fulfilment Operations Specialist, you will be part of the Customer Fulfilment (CFF) Team, which is a fundamental part in making IKEA multichannel retailing a reality. You possess either a university degree (Logistics, Economics, Business Administration or related) or 1-2 years experience in the area of expertise. You have previous work experience in a retail, home furnishing, supply chain or customer service environment. You are a confident and clear communicator in German and English both written and verbally. ABOUT THIS WORK AREA Were the team behind the scenes that make the IKEA products available to the many people. As a diverse mix of co-workers we use our supply process expertise to balance range and space capacity with forecasting and ordering to provide customers with high availability while minimizing costs. If youve wonder whos responsible for finding effective and efficient ways of picking up the products for our customers, thats us. Were passionate about working together to improve the customer experience at IKEA! Following a first selection, successful candidates will be invited to a phone or video interview. After this step, we will invite selected applicants to a face-to-face interview with the line manager and possibly other stakeholders. Early or late shifts within our opening hours and Saturday assignments will be part of your working schedule.

Hauptverantwortlichkeiten (Titel) DU BIST VERANTWORTLICH FÜR Hauptverantwortlichkeiten (Titel) • Mithilfe bei der Schaffung eines aussergewöhnlichen IKEA-Einkaufserlebnisses und der Sicherstellung der Kundenzufriedenheit. Zusammen mit Tausenden Kolleginnen und Kollegen weltweit sind wir ein vielfältiges Team, das am kontinuierlichen globalen Erfolg des IKEA Konzepts arbeitet - ein Konzept, dass Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden beider Gestaltung eines besseren Alltags unterstützt! Das ist IKEA. Ikea Bewerberprofil (Titel) Wir suchen aufgeschlossene Verkaufsmitarbeitende, die unsere Kundinnen und Kunden nicht nur freundlich und kompetent beraten, sondern denen es ein Anliegen ist ihnen ein aussergewöhnliches Einkaufserlebnis zu bieten. Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Vertrieb oder im Kundenservice. Wir kennen die Kundenbedürfnisse, unser Produktsortiment, die lokalen Märkte und finden neue Wege, eine echte Verbindung zu unseren Kunden zu haben. Zusammen mit Tausenden Kolleginnen und Kollegen weltweit sind wir ein vielfältiges Team, das am kontinuierlichen globalen Erfolg des IKEA Konzepts arbeitet - ein Konzept, dass Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden beider Gestaltung eines besseren Alltags unterstützt! Lokaler Abschnitt (Titel) - Standardsprache GUT ZU WISSEN Lokaler Abschnitt (eQuest) Bitte reiche deine Bewerbung inklusive Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben und allen anderen relevanten Dokumenten online ein. Nach einer ersten Auswahl werden erfolgreiche Bewerbende zu einem Telefon- oder Videointerview eingeladen. Aufgrund dessen erfolgt eine zweite Auswahl nach der wir die ausgewählten Bewerbenden zu einem persönlichen Gespräch mit den Manager und möglicherweise anderen Beteiligten einladen. Wir prüfen die Bewerbungen laufend und werden diese Stelle schliessen, sobald wir die richtige Kandidatin oder den richtigen Kandidaten gefunden haben. Auf dieser Stelle ist es wichtig, dass du in Bezug auf die Arbeitszeiten flexibel bist. Früh- oder Spätschichten im Rahmen unserer Öffnungszeiten sowie Samstagseinsätze sollten für dich selbstverständlich sein. WARUM DU UNS MÖGEN WIRST Aus den tiefen Wäldern Schwedens haben wir unsere Kultur und unsere Werte bis in die ganze Welt verbreitet. Im Zentrum unseres Angebots stehen unsere wunderschönen Heimeinrichtungsprodukte und -lösungen, die umweltschonend hergestellt wurden und Millionen Kundinnen und Kunden erreichen. Im Zentrum unseres Geschäfts stehen unsere wunderbaren Mitarbeitenden, die Vielfalt in allen Bereichen und Leidenschaft für das Leben zuhause repräsentieren. Wir alle bringen unsere Einzigartigkeit ein und möchten gemeinsam wachsen und uns weiterentwickeln. Unsere Vision, "den vielen Menschen einen besseren Alltag schaffen", inspiriert und leitet uns bei unserem gesamten Handeln. Das ist IKEA. Da wir unsere Hilfeleistungen weltweit anbieten, wendest Du zudem Deine Fremdsprachenkenntnisse täglich an und entwickelst diese weiter. Deine Verantwortung Wir arbeiten ausschliesslich im Namen unserer Auftraggeber. Dies sind vor allem Versicherungsgesellschaften, für die wir vorwiegend medizinische Notfälle im Ausland bearbeiten. Deine Tätigkeit wird überaus dynamisch : Du hilfst Kunden, indem Du deren medizinischen Notfälle entgegennimmst und die weiter notwendigen Schritte einleitest. Wir sind 24 / 7 für unsere Kunden da. Mit den im Fall involvierten internen Ansprechpartnern arbeitest Du eng verzahnt. Deine Qualifikation Nebst Deutsch in Wort und Schrift sprichst Du auch sehr gut Französisch und Englisch. Ganz wichtig ist, dass Du gerne Menschen weiterhelfen und sehr gut mit ihnen umgehen kannst, weil Du verstehst, in welcher Situation sie sich gerade befinden. Du kommunizierst geschickt und weisst, wann Du wen, wie, mit welchen Informationen versorgen musst. Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene Berufslehre, Maturität oder Studium und hast kaufmännische Erfahrung. Du bist technisch versiert und kannst Dich in kurzer Zeit in den verschiedenen IT-Systemen ohne Probleme einarbeiten. Du bist sicher in der Anwendung von Office. Als Teamplayer bist Du richtig bei uns.
