These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. Our manufacturing facility is conveniently located on the edge of RTP right off Interstate 40. Experience working with computerized system (bioreactors, chromatography systems, filtration units). MS Word, MS Excel. Must be able to perform simple mathematical calculations including addition and multiplication. NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS 1st Shift position Monday thru Friday 8 hours Occasional weekend work is expected. Departement: Rektorat Arbeitsbeginn: Ab November 2021 oder nach Vereinbarung Ihre Aufgaben Die ZHAW führt ab 2022 ein neues Modell zur koordinierten Handhabung des Nachteilsausgleich ein. Weiter werden einheitliche Prozesse eingeführt, die Administration digitalisiert und die Zusammenarbeit zwischen den Beteiligten kontinuierlich koordiniert. Sie prüfen die Anträge und Nachweise und erstellen in Rücksprache mit den Departementen und den Betroffenen die Empfehlungen für den Nachteilsausgleich. Bei Bedarf nehmen Sie eine Vermittlungsfunktion zwischen Studierenden und Departementen ein und suchen nach einvernehmlichen Lösungen. Ihr Profil Wir suchen eine erfahrene Fachperson, welche Freude an Beratung innerhalb eines institutionellen Rahmens hat und die professionelle Handhabung des Nachteilsausgleichs strukturell vorantreiben möchte. Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Hochschulausbildung (ab Bachelor-Niveau) in einem relevanten Fachgebiet und bringen praxisbezogene Berufserfahrung im Bereich Behinderung und Beratung mit. Sie denken strukturiert und Ihre Erfahrung im Projektmanagement und Ihr Gestaltungswille helfen Ihnen, den NTA als ZHAW-weiten Prozess zu steuern und bei Bedarf weiterzuentwickeln. Die Beratungsarbeit ist von Peaks zu Beginn der Semester geprägt. Wir freuen uns auf eine engagierte Fachperson, welche durch ihre kompetente NTA-Beratung zur Chancengerechtigkeit an der ZHAW beiträgt und unser Team menschlich und fachlich bereichert. Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen bis am 19. Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir ausschliesslich Bewerbungen via Onlineplattform berücksichtigen und somit keine Bewerbungen per Briefpost oder per E-Mail bearbeiten.

| Die Welt verändert sich stärker und schneller denn je. Unser globales Versprechen : Building a better working world leitet dabei unsere mehr als 300 000 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen rund um den Globus und bietet die Basis für die Arbeit die wir jeden Tag leisten. Mit unseren innovativen Dienstleistungen in der Wirtschaftsprüfung, Steuerberatung, Transaktions- und Managementberatung führen wir unsere Mandanten in die Zukunft. Unsere Financial Services Organisation ist bei den Big4-Unternehmungen die einzige mit funktionaler und länderübergreifender Spezialisierung im Finanzdienstleistungssektor. In unseren Business Consulting Services bist Du sowohl in der Management- und Unternehmensberatung als auch in der aufsichtsrechtlichen Prüfung tätig. Wir bieten unseren Kunden auf der ganzen Welt nahtlose, konsistente und qualitativ hochwertige Dienstleistungen an. Das erwartet Dich bei uns Erfahrungen, von denen Du ein Leben lang profitierst Als Teil unserer Sparte Business Consulting Services ist unser Financial Services Risk Team ebenfalls integriert in das globale Netzwerk von Risikomanagement Spezialisten, welche unsere Kunden weltweit mit Lösungen auf dem Gebiet der Identifikation, Messung, Steuerung und Überwachung finanzieller und operationeller Risiken unterstützt. Zudem wirst Du stark in die aufsichtsrechtliche Prüfung der Basel III und FINMA-Vorgaben unserer Kunden einbezogen. Dabei siehst du tief in Fachgebiete hinein und lernst unsere vielseitige Kundenstruktur kennen, welche von kleinen Banken bis hin zu international tätigen Grossbanken ein sehr breites Spektrum umfasst. Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden zusammen und lieferst massgeschneiderte Lösungen in Themen wie Risikomanagement, internationale Finanzmarkt-Regulation und in der Ausführung komplexer Projekte. Ein Plus : akademische Vorkenntnisse im Bereich Banking und Finanzmarkt-Regulation, praktische Arbeitserfahrung im Risikomanagement sowie Kenntnisse einer gängigen Programmiersprache (R, VBA, Python, C# usw.). Als international tätiges Unternehmen setzen wir gute Deutsch und Englisch Kenntnisse voraus . Halte an ihnen fest und verwirkliche Deine Ziele mit uns! Gestalte Deine Karriere bei EY : in einer Kultur, die Vielfalt und Weiterbildung fördert in einem Umfeld, das Dir durch Wissensaustausch, Flexibilität und Anerkennung ständig neue Türen öffnet an einem modernen Arbeitsort welcher die nötige Flexibilität bietet in einer offenen und gemeinschaftlichen Arbeitskultur basierend auf Ehrlichkeit, Integrität und gegenseitigem Respekt Während deiner Anstellung bei uns hast du die Möglichkeit einen anerkannten, firmeneigenen und kostenlosen MBA (EY Tech MBA) der Hult International Business School zu erwerben kostenlos. Es liegt in deiner Hand. It’s yours to build. Mach jetzt den nächsten Schritt und bewirb dich online für deine neue Herausforderung. ausgenommen sind EY-Contractors, Praktikanten und Alumni.

Pourquoi tu y parviens Diplôme (CFC) en informatique ou diplôme équivalent Bonnes compétences en systèmes et réseaux (Exchange, Microsoft, Linux, Cisco, Checkpoint, Storage, Virtualisation) Expérience minimum de 3 ans dans l'administration système et réseaux Disposition à travailler en dehors des heures ouvrées et à intégrer le service de piquet environ une semaine par mois Capacité à gérer le stress, très bon esprit d'équipe Flexibilité et rigueur; professionnalisme dans les relations avec les clients Très bon niveau de français, bon niveau d'anglais à l'écrit et à l'oral Ce qui t’attend Conditions de travail équitables Tu bénéficies des conditions d’engagement avancées de la convention collective de travail Swisscom (CCT). Prestations sociales généreuses Swisscom te propose une prévoyance vieillesse étendue via la caisse de pensions comPlan, avec des variantes individuelles pour réaliser des économies. Monde du travail Swisscom encourage activement l’innovation et l’amélioration permanente et te place au cœur du processus. Fringe Benefits Nous t’offrons un rabais mensuel attrayant sur certains produits Swisscom. Ce que tu fais avancer Tu mets tout en œuvre dans le traitement des tickets qui sont attribués à l'équipe en respectant les délais et les procédures actuelles. Par ailleurs, tu t'engages dans le service de piquet et apportes ton aide ponctuellement en dehors des heures ouvrées, en rotation avec les autres membres de l'équipe. Nos équipes sont interdisciplinaires. Le coworking, le prototyping et les modes de travail agiles font pleinement partie de notre culture. Nous t’octroyons 18 semaines de congé de maternité et 3 semaines de congé de paternité.

Dank dir werden unsere Kundinnen und Kunden nicht nur mit einem Lächeln IKEA besuchen, sie werden auch mit einem Lächeln unsere Einrichtungshäuser verlassen und sich darauf freuen, wiederzukommen. ÜBER DIESEN ARBEITSBEREICH    Bei IKEA dreht sich alles um unsere Kundinnen und Kunden. Als vielfältiges Team arbeiten wir daran allen Kundinnen und Kunden sowie Besuchenden ein positives IKEA Erlebnis zu ermöglichen - durch unseren Service, indem wir Feedback einholen und Dinge richtig machen! WER DU BIST    Wir suchen Mitarbeiterinnen oder Mitarbeiter im Kundenservice, denen es Spass macht, unseren Kundinnen und Kunden mit Rat und Tat zur Seite zu stehen und ihnen das bestmögliche Einkaufserlebnis zu bieten. Dank dir werden unsere Kundinnen und Kunden nicht nur mit einem Lächeln IKEA besuchen, sie werden auch mit einem Lächeln unsere Einrichtungshäuser verlassen und sich darauf freuen, wiederzukommen. Du fühlst dich sicher im Umgang mit der englischen Sprache, so dass du immer von internationalen Kunden angesprochen werden kannst. In Småland: Sicherstellen, dass die Kinder im Alter von 3 bis 10 Jahren in guten Händen sind. ÜBER DIESEN ARBEITSBEREICH    Bei IKEA dreht sich alles um unsere Kundinnen und Kunden. Daher nutzen wir in unserem Team mehrere Verkaufskanäle um langfristige Beziehungen zu pflegen und neu aufzubauen. Unsere Vorgehensweise: Mit Menschen reden, ihnen zuhören und echte Verständigung schaffen. Wir sind eine Gruppe von Menschen, die eine Leidenschaft für Begegnungen haben! Nach einer ersten Auswahl werden erfolgreiche Bewerbende zu einem Telefon- oder Videointerview eingeladen. Aufgrund dessen erfolgt eine zweite Auswahl nach der wir die ausgewählten Bewerbenden zu einem persönlichen Gespräch mit dem Manager und möglicherweise anderen Beteiligten einladen. Wir prüfen die Bewerbungen laufend und werden diese Stelle schliessen, sobald wir die richtige Kandidatin oder den richtigen Kandidaten gefunden haben. Auf dieser Stelle ist es wichtig, dass du in Bezug auf die Arbeitszeiten flexibel bist. Früh- oder Spätschichten im Rahmen unserer Öffnungszeiten sowie Samstagseinsätze sollten für dich selbstverständlich sein. Erfolgreiche Bewerbende sind verpflichtet vor Erhalt des Vertrags ihren Strafregisterauszug einzureichen.

| This position will partner with Global Marketing in defining brand strategy, claims and evidence, and new product launch strategy for Alcon’s Digital Health Solutions to ensure that the product / brand strategy aligns to the needs of International markets. Major Accountabilities : Develop marketing strategies, programs / campaigns & ready-to-use promotional materials (physical and digital content) : 1. in partnership with Global Marketing for new Product Launches 2. independently for established in-line products Provide marketing plan direction, guidance, and oversight to ensure best-in-class marketing execution (for new product launches & established in- line products), cross-market consistency (where appropriate), and maximum marketing ROI (by minimizing duplication and maximizing impact), including Medical Affairs plans, scientific evidence, and podium presence Coordinate all international brand marketing initiatives that will help the top 12 international markets achieve the annual and intermediate-term sales and market share objectives Provide strategic input for Medical / Economic Evidence and publication plans as member of world-wide Medical Evidence Teams Regularly update campaign materials and promotional assets as Alcon and competitor market presence evolves and customer needs / preferences change Synthesize and share best practices (e. g. lessons learned new product launch lead markets, etc.) We are specifically seeking those with experience leading / executing Digital Health strategy and SaaS solutions and related professional services. Works closely with key members of the IMG Team, including the Area Marketing team which supports all International markets beyond the Top 12 Experience & Competencies : 8+ years of broad experience in progressive marketing positions in highly competitive global medical devices, pharmaceutical or consumer health care product industries (customer facing / sales experience and / or ophthalmology experience preferred, but not required) Experience developing and launching Digital Health products and services, especially revenue-generating SaaS solutions and related professional services Strong technical aptitude, work experience and training on technologies, particularly those relevant to Healthcare systems integration Previous experience in a country marketing role Proven expertise in global product strategy, brand marketing, and portfolio management Track-record of successful, multi-country new product launches Capability to work in a complex global framework, including strong stakeholder experience and ability to lead cross functional teams in a fast-paced and high-demand environment Demonstrated strong long-term strategic thinking and planning for business success.

Dein Wirkungsfeld - In der Distributionszone Zürich suchen wir für die Distributionsbasis Hinwil motivierte Lehrabgänger*innen zur Ergänzung unseres Zustellteams. - Du packst tatkräftig mit an und lädst gemeinsam mit deinen Teamkolleginnen und Teamkollegen die Pakete in den Lieferwagen. - Bei Wind und Wetter bist du selbstständig draussen auf Zustelltour unterwegs. - Du erfasst mit einem Smartphone die Sendungen und übergibst diese persönlich unseren Kundinnen und Kunden in der geforderten Qualität. - Sympathisch und kompetent beantwortest du individuelle Anfragen zu unseren Dienstleistungen. - Die Arbeitszeiten sind täglich von Montag bis Freitag, teilweise Samstag von 06:00 bis ca. Wir arbeiten in der Regel in einer 5-Tage-Woche. - Du besitzt den Führerausweis Kategorie B mit regelmässiger Fahrpraxis.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Then we're the right company for you.What you can expect from us* An international and interdisciplinary team with learning on the job opportunities* The opportunity to take on functions with client contact and responsibility for cross-divisional projects in various industries from the first day and to advise our clients on complex tax issues, for example in the tax planning of a multinational company or in an M&A transaction* A clear, long-term career path with internal and external professional training offers as well as the time and financial assistance necessary for the training to become a dipl. Tax expert or study the MAS FH in Swiss and International Taxation / LL.M. Global IT Category Manager (80-100%) Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Head of IS Operations and applications you will be responsible for SLA fulfilment, supplier sustainability/compliance, cash management and cost reduction with a TCO perspective; establish and run proper governance on strategic and operational level with relevant suppliers Your background Strong IT background and proven track record in comparable position of 5-10 years; experience in implementing applications like SAP, SAP BW, MS Dynamics CRM, CAx/PDM Relationship and conflict management Strong negotiation skills with experience in contract management for IT services Navigating tricky situations with tact and respect yielding positive results Strategic thinking and creative problem solving along with being adaptable Detail orientation, creativity Availability to navigate dense, complex documents and then advocate for your business Communication and collaboration skills Fluency in English required Benefits Canteen Childcare Flexible work practices More about us ABB Turbocharging (www.abb.com/turbocharging) is at the helm of the global industry in the manufacture and maintenance of turbochargers for 500 kW to 80+ MW diesel and gas engines. Approximately 200.000 ABB turbochargers are in operation across the globe on ships, power stations, gen-sets, diesel locomotives and large, off-highway vehicles. November 19, 2020, ABB announced the planned divestment of its Turbocharging Division. Turbocharging is a successful and profitable Division in a mature market and has been for long a highly self-reliant business within ABB. ABB has decided to take this step, acknowledging that for Turbocharging to realize its full potential going forward, a new setup is required. As the next step, alternative ownership options, including a spin-off to the Swiss stock market, will be assessed, considering value for customers, ABB and the future of the turbocharging business. The recruiting process is being led by Elina Seibold, Talent Partner ABB Switzerland Ltd. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Das Unternehmen HALBA mit Firmensitz in Pratteln (BL) gehört zur Coop-Gruppe und zählt rund 400 Mitarbeitende. HALBA ist spezialisiert auf das nationale wie auch internationale B2B-Business und produziert für weltweit rund 100 Kunden jährlich 20 000 Tonnen Schweizer Schokoladen, 7 000 Tonnen Snacks wie auch 30 000 Tonnen Back- & Kochzutaten. Als glaubwürdige Nachhaltigkeitspionierin engagiert sich HALBA in den Ursprungsländern mit wegweisenden Nachhaltigkeitsprojekten und pflegt in regelmässigem Austausch die Nähe zu Produzenten, Lieferanten, Kunden und Partnern. Then look no further and join our Product and Application Management Team in Mnnedorf, Switzerland as Application Specialist NGS (Lab Automation) 80-100% What you will do In this new role you will focus on developing optimized scripts for Tecans own and 3rd party Genomics reagents that will be part of Tecans solutions offer. Responsibilities will include Developing scripts to operate Tecans liquid handlers with various NGS library prep kits Demonstrating script functionality via testing in alignment with internal or partners requirements Assembling necessary documentation and technical marketing materials for script release Testing new hardware and software components for NGS library prep automation Being the technical point of contact for external and internal stakeholders in NGS library prep automation and collecting technical and scientific feedback from customers and partners Working closely with Product Managers and other members of the Genomics Automation team during new product development Supporting pre- and post-launch activities such as customer support, trainings, technical writing and scientific content creation for marketing What you bring along Master Degree or PhD in Life Science, Biology/Biochemistry with focus on NGS Prior experience with liquid handling automation scripting and/or programming is a plus Minimum two to three years of hands-on work experience in academic or industry settings with NGS library kits Good understanding of NGS library prep kit properties from different vendors Knowledge of good laboratory practices Fluent English skills; German skills are an advantage Strong communication skills Customer-oriented mind-set Highly structured with integrative and analytical way of thinking Readiness to travel up to 20% What you will get Progressive employment conditions Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits package Exciting career opportunities Wide range of training courses International and diverse environment (30+ different nationalities) Strong company culture with rich history Global mindset with Swissness at heart Extremely attractive location overlooking the lake of Zurich Look no further and apply now! Wir pflegen eine frische Marktküche und unsere Lieferanten kommen aus der Region. Was möglich ist und Sinn macht, produzieren wir im Hause selber. Sie verfügen über solide Erfahrungen in ähnlichen Positionen oder haben schon sehr gute Erfahrungen als Sous-Chef. Sie sind verantwortlich für: direktes Führen und Fördern der Küchenbrigade Einkauf und Lagerung der Lebensmittel Ansprechsperson für Lieferanten und Vertreter die Gestaltung der Speisekarte für unsere Hausgäste und die Restaurants die hochwertige Produktion und Fertigung sowie Kontrolle der marktfrischen Speisen aktive Mitarbeit im Team Kontrolle und Einhaltung der HACCP Vorschriften Sie sind Koch mit Leib uns Seele und lieben eine marktfrische Küche. Als Privatbetrieb pflegen wir ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima und tendieren auf eine längere Zusammenarbeit. Eine moderne Arbeitszeiterfassung ist für uns selbstverständlich. Wenn Sie möchten stellen wir Ihnen eine Unterkunft zur Verfügung oder helfen Ihnen bei der Suche nach einer Unterkunft. Sie arbeiten und leben in einem der schönsten Tourismusorte der Schweiz.

Zusammen mit dem Team treibst du die HR Administration in die Zukunft und bist ein wichtiger Partner für IKEA. Zusammenarbeit mit verschieden Stakeholder, mit dem du dich über bewährte Lösungen und Standards bei IKEA im Bereich Personaladministration austauschst ABOUT THIS WORK AREA Bei IKEA stehen die Menschen im Mittelpunkt. Unser Team unterstützt das IKEA Geschäft durch Mitarbeiterprozesse, die auf den IKEA Werten und der einzigartigen Sicht von IKEA auf die Menschen beruhen. WHO YOU ARE In dieser Funktion lernst du unsere HR-Prozesse kennen, du kannst dein Wissen in neue Technologien erweitern und deine Fähigkeiten rund um das Thema Automatisierungs- und Digitalisierungsprozesse als auch Robotics Process Automation ausbauen. Zusammen mit dem Team treibst du die HR Administration in die Zukunft und bist ein wichtiger Partner für IKEA. Du bringst idealerweise eine kaufmännische oder technische Grundausbildung oder ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, idealerweise mit dem Schwerpunkt IT oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang mit. Dir macht es Spass dich in neuen Gebieten einzuarbeiten und du suchst stets nach Verbesserungen, dabei bist du vor allem für die Automatisierung und Robotics zuständig. Du hast den Mut Entscheidungen zu treffen und den Wunsch, dich selbst persönlich und fachlich weiterzuentwickeln. Verantwortlich für die Prozessautomatisierungen, Robotic Process Automation oder bei technischen Entwicklungsthemen die Stakeholder beratend zur Seite stehen. Mit deiner inspirierenden Art und Weise teilst du dein Wissen mit dem Team und trägst dazu bei die gemeinsamen Ziele zu erreichen. Unser Team unterstützt das IKEA Geschäft durch Mitarbeiterprozesse, die auf den IKEA Werten und der einzigartigen Sicht von IKEA auf die Menschen beruhen. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass unterschiedliche Erfahrungen und Hintergründe uns als Gemeinschaft stärker und klüger machen. Wir schaffen eine stabile Grundlage, auf der sich unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter weiterentwickeln können, während sie unser Geschäft ausbauen. Nach einer ersten Auswahl werden erfolgreiche Bewerbende zu einem Telefon- oder Videointerview eingeladen. Aufgrund dessen erfolgt eine zweite Auswahl nach der wir die ausgewählten Bewerbenden zu einem persönlichen Gespräch mit dem Manager und möglicherweise anderen Beteiligten einladen. Wir prüfen die Bewerbungen laufend und werden diese Stelle schliessen, sobald wir die richtige Kandidatin oder den richtigen Kandidaten gefunden haben. Auf dieser Stelle ist es wichtig, dass du in Bezug auf die Arbeitszeiten flexibel bist. Früh- oder Spätschichten im Rahmen unserer Öffnungszeiten sowie Samstagseinsätze sollten für dich selbstverständlich sein. Erfolgreiche Bewerbende sind verpflichtet vor Erhalt des Vertrags ihren Strafregisterauszug einzureichen.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer.

WHO YOU ARE Candidate profile (text) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL Together with the Team Leader Sales you will drive the optimization of the IKEA shopping experience in your sales area in order to secure an excellent customer experience and thus influence sales growth. Key responsibilities (title) YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES Key responsibilities (text) - en_UK / en_INTERNATIONAL • Making sure that your sales area is in excellent condition, fully stocked and the IKEA product range presented in ways that inspire the customers. Understanding and making the best commercial use of the various IKEA sales and communication channels to reach customers. Supporting the Team Leader Sales in steering the sales to your department's top-selling products, prioritised products and IKEA service products in order to maximise sales and long-term profitability. Ringier is a diversified media company with about 7,300 employees across 19 countries. Basic Info Location Baden, Aargau, Switzerland Job type Full-Time Contract Regular/Permanent Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. You will be active for the railway segment, working in conjunction and close cooperation with ABB local sales and tendering organization of the countries. Through your activity you will promote the ABB portfolio and solutions to railway stakeholders (EPCs’, system integrators, consulting companies, railway and urban transportation operators) in order to achieve ABB market penetration and growth aspirations. Givaudan recently launched its updated and strengthened responsible sourcing program, Sourcing4Good. As a Responsible Sourcing Manager you will help drive the program through our end-to-end supply chain by working with the RS team to drive the implementation of our responsible sourcing projects following Givaudan's corporate strategy and targets. Work with suppliers and external partners to identify gaps against the Givaudan Responsible Sourcing Policy throughout supply chains in each spend category Identify necessary improvements, agree and accomplish action plans and monitor progress: Drive the gathering and accumulation of materials attributes data to meet our customers' increasing demands for supply chain information. Communications: Be an ambassador for Sourcing4Good both inside and outside the business, and for Givaudan's Purpose and Sustainability goals. Use our communications platforms to bring visibility to Givaudan's sustainability and responsible sourcing activities. Ability to transform data into useful information and a convincing presentation Passion for learning and sharing expertise on sustainability topics Open-minded and creative in finding innovative, effective solutions Experienced in budget management Some of our Benefits: Paid Time Off and family leave Retirement plan Sport and leisure clubs At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people’s lives. Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world. Givaudan Responsible Sourcing Manager - Your future position? As a Responsible Sourcing Manager you will help drive the program through our end-to-end supply chain by working with the RS team to drive the implementation of our responsible sourcing projects following Givaudan's corporate strategy and targets. To be based in a European facility, such as: Multiple locations: Vernier (Switzerland), Kemptthal (Switzerland), Ashford (UK), Argenteuil (FR) In this exciting role your main responsibilities will be the following: Implementation: Determine yearly action plans with essential milestones for your portfolio. Business Partnering: Promote the responsible sourcing program with all relevant partners. Develop and deliver regular training to category managers and suppliers. Communications: Be an ambassador for Sourcing4Good both inside and outside the business, and for Givaudan's Purpose and Sustainability goals. Use our communications platforms to bring visibility to Givaudan's sustainability and responsible sourcing activities. Your successful profile includes: Bachelor's degree or equivalent in, Environmental Sciences, Engineering or Sustainability or a related field Minimum 5 years' experience in responsible or sustainable sourcing or sustainability topics and sustainability standards Experience in an international environment within a matrix organization Experience in creating valuable improvements throughout supply chains in a direct and indirect supplier setting, including up to farm level Experience in sustainable sourcing of commodities, such as Palm products and RSPO certification Fluent in written and verbal English, any other language would be appreciated Knowledge in local field-project staff, local communities, government agencies, the not-for-profit sector and the scientific community Solid project management experience with a structured and process-driven approach, and the ability to record, measure and document progress Ability to build teams and navigate with autonomy.

Administration Lausanne, Switzerland Description Position at Logitech The Role: The Junior Data Scientist ideal candidate will work in the Data Science team from the Analytics & Machine Learning department and will run analytical experiments and will regularly evaluate alternate models via theoretical approaches. In this role you will: Implement Machine Learning and Deep Learning models Contribute positively as a team player in order to increase the team’s contribution to Logitech success Contribute to the extension of the long term vision of the team Key Qualifications: For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and behaviors to our team: Familiarity with Python Good knowledge of Unsupervised and Supervised ML algorithms including Neural Networks /Deep Learning Familiarity with Text Mining, Natural Language Processing, and Social Network Graphs Understanding of Business purpose of a project Ability to transition from the Prrof of Concept phase to a final application Ideally, already had exposure to large data sets In addition, preferable skills and behaviors include: Team player Ability to adapt to any situation Entrepreneurial / innovation mindset Hands-on to get things done fast and able to work in ambiguity and without continual guidance Inquisitive mind with the ability to recognize inefficiencies and challenge the status quo Attention to detail combined with creative thinking Good written and verbal communication skills Ability to connect easily with colleagues Ability to tailor insights to present clearly to technical and non-technical audiences Multi-cultural exposure, especially exposed to our three regions’ cultures Education: Bachelor degree in Business Analytics or Engineering with a background in statistics Logitech is the sweet spot for people who are passionate about products, making a mark, and having fun doing it.As a company, we’re small and flexible enough for every person to take initiative and make things happen. Description du poste Die LANDI Schweiz AG stellt als schweizerische Grosshandelsgesellschaft in den Bereichen Garten-, Landwirtschaft-, Kleintier-, Haushalt-, Do-it- und Freizeitartikeln, Agro- und Pet-Food im Rahmen der Marketing- und Dienstleistungsorganisation den Erfolg der LANDI Verkaufsstellen in der ganzen Schweiz sicher. Unser Sitz befindet sich in Dotzigen. Für unsere Informatik suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine teamfähige und dynamische Persönlichkeit als IT Projektleiter/in und Business-Analyst/in 100% (m/w). Ihre Aufgaben In dieser anspruchsvollen Funktion übernehmen Sie die selbständige Leitung von IT Projekten im Rahmen der Weiterentwicklung der Landi Schweiz AG. Weiter analysieren Sie die Kundenanforderungen, Geschäftsprozesse, Informationsbestände sowie den IT-Mitteleinsatz und erarbeiten konzeptionelle Grundlagen sowie organisatorische und technische Lösungsvorschläge und sind die Schnittstelle zum Business. Planung und Koordination der Einführung/Weiterentwicklung von operativ/technischen Prozessen zur Unterstützung der Geschäftsprozesse zusammen mit externen Dienstleistungspartnern Durchführung und Begleitung von Vorstudien, Erstellen von Lösungskonzepten sowie Evaluation der Lösungskomponenten Mitwirkung bei der Entwicklung von technischen und organisatorischen Projekten gemäss ICT-Strategie Analysieren von bestehenden Prozessen, identifizieren von Verbesserungspotentialen und Aufnahme der Business Anforderungen Ihr Profil Fachausweis in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder Betriebswirtschaft oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Langjährige Berufserfahrung in der Rolle als IT Projektleiter/in oder Business-Analyst/in in IT- oder Digitalisierungsprojekten Idealerweise Projektmanagement-Zertifizierung oder langjährige Erfahrung in der Abwicklung von IT-Projekten (z.B. Hermes, IPMA, usw.) Methodenkenntnis der Wirtschaftsinformatik, insbesondere der Anforderungs-, Daten- und Prozessanalyse Gutes IT-Generalisten-Know-how mit Vertiefung in einzelne Fachgebiete Hohe Kundenorientierung und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit Solide Deutsch- und Französischkenntnisse, Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil Ihre Vorteile Wir bieten Ihnen eine spannende und abwechslungsreiche Anstellung in einem erfolgreichen und wachsenden Schweizer Unternehmen mit guten Sozialleistungen und mindestens 5 Wochen Ferien.

Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Im Gegenzug steuern unsere Mitarbeitenden ihre Karriere selbstständig. Denn ihre Ideen, ob gross und klein, verbessern die Welt. Und das ist die Art von Arbeit, an der wir Teil haben möchten. Wir sind kürzlich als der globale Herstellungspartner für die Produktion der Moderna Impfung gegen den Coronavirus bestätigt worden. Als Partner ermöglichen wir eine Verzehnfachung der Produktionskapazität. Wir sind in der glücklichen Lage, in Zeiten grosser Unsicherheit für viele Unternehmen, die Möglichkeit nachhaltigen Wachstums zu haben. Schliesse dich Schindler an und hilf uns, die Welt der Mobilität zu verbessern: Nutze deine Fähigkeiten und bewege mit uns die Menschen. We Elevate Schindler Schindler wurde 1874 in der Schweiz gegründet und zählt als familiengeführtes Unternehmen mit globaler Präsenz zu den Weltmarkmarktführern im Bereich Aufzüge, Fahrtreppen und Fahrsteige. Über eine Milliarde Menschen vertrauen täglich auf Schindler. Unsere langjährige Erfahrung und Innovationskraft machen uns zur Nummer eins im Schweizer Aufzugs- und Fahrtreppengeschäft. Gestalte mit uns die Welt von morgen, als Elektrikerin / Elektriker als Monteurin / Monteur für Aufzüge 80-100% Du bewegst... Möchtest du wissen, wie ein Aufzug in ein Gebäude eingebaut wird? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Wenn du auch die folgende Checkliste abhaken kannst, solltest du dich unbedingt bei uns bewerben: Abgeschlossene technische oder elektrische Ausbildung, z.B. AutomechanikerIn, MechatronikerIn oder ElektrikerIn 1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung im erlernten Beruf Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten auf der Baustelle macht dir Spass Du bist fit und schwindelfrei Du hast einen gültigen Führerschein Du hast die Chance... In unserem Trainingscenter wirst du bei vollem Lohn gründlich eingearbeitet und bist damit gut vorbereitet, um danach selbständig und flexibel deinen Job zu meistern. Du bist unabhängig mit deinem Firmenfahrzeug unterwegs und gestaltest deinen Tag eigenständig. Willst du mit uns die Mobilität von morgen gestalten? Menschen, Leidenschaft und Innovation sind die Säulen unseres Erfolgs als führendes Unternehmen in unserer Branche. Sei Teil eines hoch motivierten Teams, das mit viel Engagement und Leidenschaft die Ergebnisse unseres Unternehmens beeinflusst und höchste Qualität anstrebt. We Elevate Schindler

employer_description: About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. Cyber Risk Services at Deloitte In a rapidly changing world where information is the new currency, the corresponding information security and privacy have become a board level challenge. Deloitte has the largest Cyber capability of the Big 4 in the European marketplace with over 600 Cyber Risk Specialists staffing thousands of client engagements. Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any question, please contact Irina Rusu at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. About Deloitte Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Cyber Risk Services at Deloitte In a rapidly changing world where information is the new currency, the corresponding information security and privacy have become a board level challenge. In addition, you can drill deep and become a specialist within an industry sector or grow as a generalist. What youll do Advising organisations on how good cyber security looks like based on data, cyber security threats and risks they face as an organisation within their industry Identifying and explaining cyber risks within complex new digital transformation initiatives You will shape and deliver innovative solutions by implementing people, governance, process or technological improvements You will work alongside our Cyber leads to develop disruptive market propositions across a number of industries You will build and develop long-term relationships with (senior) cyber professionals and other relevant stakeholders across our client organisations You will lead high-profile security transformation programmes to deliver security improvements and help deliver a step-change in security capability What you need A clear and demonstrable understanding in 2-3 security domains inclusive but not limited to; advanced threat readiness and protection, application protection, identity and access management, cloud security, incident response, information privacy and protection, cyber risk analytics and vulnerability management Technical or specialist experience with supporting certifications in one or more of; Interactive Storytelling Developer* 80% oder mehr | Start: nach Vereinbarung | Standort: Zürich Deine neue Rolle: Das Interaktiv-Team entwickelt Animationen, Karten, Infografiken, Datenprojekte und neue Storytelling-Formate für sämtliche Tamedia-Titel. Firmenbeschreibung & -kultur: Die Entstehung von Tamedia geht auf den 1893 gegründeten «Tages-Anzeiger» zurück. Tamedia gehört zur TX Group. Als Interactive Storytelling Developer (auch bekannt als Interaction Designer oder Frontend-Developer) bist du verantwortlich für die Umsetzung unseres Produkteportfolios. Du programmierst im Tages- und Wochenrhythmus interaktive Schwerpunkte und optimierst laufend das im Team verwendete Toolset. Dieser Job ist für dich, wenn du ein Flair für digitalen Journalismus hast und dich über die laufende Entwicklung in diesem Bereich informierst. dir Technologien wie React, Webpack, npm, TypeScript, Jest, D3, Semantic UI und Firebase bekannt sind. du sattelfest bist in der modernen Web-Frontend-Entwicklung mit HTML5, CSS3, SVG und JavaScript. du es gewohnt bist, Daten über REST-Schnittstellen zu beziehen und zu verarbeiten sowie modulare, wiederverwendbare Codes zu schreiben. du aufgeschlossen und flexibel bist in der Zusammenarbeit mit unterschiedlichen Ressorts sowie externen Fachexperten. Firmenbeschreibung & -kultur: Die Entstehung von Tamedia geht auf den 1893 gegründeten «Tages-Anzeiger» zurück. Heute umfasst das Medienunternehmen eine grosse Vielfalt führender Tages- und Wochenzeitungen, Zeitschriften und Newsplattformen und betreibt die drei grössten Zeitungsdruckereien der Schweiz. Tamedia gehört zur TX Group. Bei uns finden sie Raum für gute Arbeit und Möglichkeiten zur individuellen Entwicklung. Dein Arbeitsplatz liegt im Herzen von Zürich mit ausgezeichneter Verkehrsanbindung. Wir arbeiten hybrid mit einem hohen Anteil an Vertrauen und Selbstorganisation.

Roche v-TAC is a software component that calculates arterial blood gas values from peripheral venous blood, supplemented with arterial oxygen saturation (SpO2) measured by pulse oximetry. Definition of analytical performance specifications for v-TAC Study planning and statistical evaluations according Clinical & Laboratory Standards Institute (CLSI) guidelines Lead of internal analytical performance studies and support of external analytical performance studies The Technical Project Leader leads these activities in a cross-functional team: Coordination of all system integration activities within R&D Continuous collaboration and coordination with Business Area, Clinical Science, Clinical Operations, Design Quality, Regulatory and Biostatistics Reporting to BA project team Key requirements: Master’s degree or PhD in Chemistry, Biology, Physics or related natural and technical sciences Passionate personality who networks well and drives this project with the System Integration team and with peers and stakeholders Ability to drive conclusions and decisions with peers and stakeholders Leadership experience in matrix organizations Experience in creation of development-, verification & validation- and submission documents according CLSI guidelines and fulfilling regulatory needs Fluent English language skills, German language skills would be a plus Roche is an equal opportunity employer. We are looking for a Technical Project Leader System Integration for v-TAC to strengthen our System Integration team.

Aufgrund unseres stetigen Wachstums und der Neueröffnung unseres temporären Grossteillagers in Nebikon (LU) suchen wir zur Verstärkung mehrere Logistikmitarbeitende. Das temporäre Grossteilelager in Nebikon wird für die Zeitspanne vom 01.03.2021 bis 01.04.2022 betrieben. Ab 01.04.2022 wird das Grossteilelager an unseren Standort in Wohlen verlegt, dessen Lagerkapazitäten aktuell erweitert werden. Als Logistikmitarbeitender hast du die Möglichkeit im ersten Anstellungsjahr in Nebikon (LU) oder Dintikon (AG) tätig zu sein. In Absprache wird dein Arbeitsort ab April 2022 nach Dintikon (AG) oder Wohlen (AG) verlegt. Dann bist du genau die richtige Person für uns! About Swiss Re Swiss Re is one of the worlds leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We are also closely collaborating with other Swiss Re teams to bring Swiss Re's expertise in assessing and handling risk to use. Swiss Re offers modern work models and attractive work places that allow all employees to adapt to changing work preferences and life phases. We offer a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. About the role We are looking for a highly driven, intrinsically motivated intern who looks to apply their creativity and leading-edge analytics skills to insurance-industry relevant issues. They will join our cross-functional team in building client solution based on both internal and external data. Adaptive & organised: you recognize industry is not university and are ready to adapt to the timescales and environment you face here. employer_description: Your work will span across all of Google's products, and you'll be encouraged to identify new opportunities for user experience improvements. Google is and always will be an engineering company. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Responsibilities Design and conduct user studies in order to gauge the usability of new and existing Google product features. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Preferred qualifications: Returning to your degree after completing the internship. We are a multi-disciplinary team of Interaction Designers, Visual Designers, User Researchers, Copywriters and Web Developers who collaborate closely with each other, and with Engineering and Product Management, to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use. We strive to connect users to the magic of our products, and your job will be to make that connection intuitive and accessible. Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

Empfang / Rezeption Reservierung Seit 1937 wohnen ganzjährig Gäste von nah und fern im Romantik Hotel Julen, unserem traditionsreichen Holzhaus, welches wir auf die Wintersaison 2019 zu grossen Teilen renoviert haben – und welches mitten im zauberhaften Matterhorndorf liegt.Den Charme und die Behaglichkeit unseres 4* Superior Hotels haben wir dabei erhalten, so verzaubert es weiterhin jüngere Gäste ebenso wie ältere und frisch Verliebte genauso wie Familien. compliance trainings In this role you act as the primary interface to the front office by supporting and advising on a specific range of compliance relevant matters, such as Know Your Client, EAM assessment, retrocessions, cross border, delegation of client identification, EAM Onboarding pre- and final clearance check as well as supporting in setting up local EAM desks You work very closely with Central Compliance functions in accordance with the global compliance mandate and in line with respective local regulatory requirements You perform supervising activities to ensure adherence to legal and regulatory requirements as well as internal policies and procedures identifying regulatory or reputational risks The possibility to work as a partner with the senior Business and Compliance management to enable business development in a controlled and compliance oriented manner Being part of a highly motivated team and a global and diverse environment You Offer University degree in law or business administration or equivalent At least 5 years of experience in the area of risk functions for Private Banking clients preferably with External Asset Manager and Shared Relationships knowledge Excellent oral and written communication skills in English are required, any additional language would be an advantage You combine analytical and conceptional skills, a structured working style that is focused on results Your strong interpersonal skills enable you to interact and present to senior management as well as to quickly gain trust and build up solid working relationships You are a dedicated problem solver who loves to balance multiple challenging priorities and assignments Are you looking for an exciting new challenge and would describe yourself as an empathetic and positive personality with a solution oriented ability and can-do attitude? WAN, LAN, Security Services, DC LAN, Wi-Fi, etc) for the SwissRe Global Network, Production Facilities for DCs and ICT Rooms, Service Transition & Decommissioning. Senior level collaboration with multiple teams including but not limited to application, security and infrastructure teams. Azure, AWS and Alibaba experience required including deploying virtual security/network appliances. Very strong technical knowledge of enterprise networking solutions for very large environments including multi cloud integration concepts such as Express Route, Direct Connect etc. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At Roche, we believe its urgent to deliver medical solutions right now even as we develop innovations for the future. The internship in Roches Group Informatics People & Culture team in Kaiseraugst offers you the unique opportunity to learn more about our mission, what we do, working in an agile organisation, how we support patients on their journey, as well as meeting and working with lots of great people! At the Roche Headquarter site in Basel/Kaiseraugst, employees from over 90 countries are doing now what our patients need next. As an intern you will join our Roche Interns Network that offers you chances to connect, have fun and get to know Basel, in the heart of Europe. What do you need in your toolbox: An understanding of project management methodologies and experience running a project A passion for people development and building strong networks Able to work independently with little guidance, have an enthusiastic and open-minded attitude Highly collaborative and an ability to multitask while remaining organized Advanced knowledge in Googles suite of applications (Mail, Calendar, Drive, Google Currents, Hangouts) Fluent in spoken and written English, German is an advantage If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients lives. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. At the Roche Headquarter site in Basel/Kaiseraugst, employees from over 90 countries are doing now what our patients need next. employer_description: Über uns H&M bietet dir ein sich schnell entwickelndes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du mit Kunden und Kollegen interagierst. Warum H&M? Wenn du einen Job bei H&M antrittst, startest du mit einem Onboarding-Plan, damit du in deiner neuen Rolle Erfolg hast. Ausserdem wirst du während deiner gesamten Karriere bei H&M Unterstützung in deiner beruflichen und persönlichen Entwicklung erhalten. Dienstjahr Dienstaltersprämie nach 10 Dienstjahren HIP-Programm (H&M-Dienstaltersbonus-Programm) Kostenlose externe Beratung durch Movis bei persönlichen und privaten Problemen Die H&M-Gruppe behält sich das Recht vor, einen oder mehrere dieser Vorteile ohne Vorankündigung zu ändern oder einzustellen. Bei H&M ist jeder Tag anders, aber hier kannst du sehen, wie ein solcher Tag aussehen kann: Sicherstellung eines hervorragenden Kundenservice auf der Verkaufsfläche, in den Kabinen und an der Kasse Ankurbelung des Umsatzes durch hervorragende Kenntnisse unseres Sortiments und unserer technischen Tools, mit denen du unsere Kunden beim Einkaufen im Store und im Onlineshop unterstützt Aufrechterhaltung einer guten Teamarbeit und aktive Unterstützung deiner Kollegen Sicherstellung einer attraktiven Warenpräsentation und einer nachhaltigen Warenpflege sowie Annahme und Verarbeitung unserer Lieferungen Befolgung unserer Store-Routinen und Richtlinien zur Unterstützung der Schadensprävention und Sicherheit und zur Sicherstellung eines attraktiven Stores Umsetzung der Kassen-Routinen und -Transaktionen, Verkaufskampagnen, Reduktionen und Preisänderungen sowie Anbringung von Sicherheitsetiketten an den Artikeln Qualifikationen Du bist kunden- und dienstleistungsorientiert und hast Spass am Verkaufen. Liebst du die Arbeit im Team? Über uns H&M bietet dir ein sich schnell entwickelndes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du mit Kunden und Kollegen interagierst. Du gibst jedem die Möglichkeit, gut auszusehen und sich gut zu fühlen. Wir bieten dir einen Arbeitsplatz, an dem jeder Tag ein Abenteuer ist, wo nur du die Grenzen für deine Karrieremöglichkeiten setzt und wo dein persönliches Wachstum und deine persönliche Entwicklung genauso wichtig sind wie unser Geschäft. Warum H&M? Wenn du einen Job bei H&M antrittst, startest du mit einem Onboarding-Plan, damit du in deiner neuen Rolle Erfolg hast. Unsere Feedback-Kultur und verschiedene interne Trainings unterstützen deinen Wachstum je nach deiner Rolle und deinen Entwicklungsbedürfnissen. Du bist offen, kommunikativ und ein ehrgeiziger, tatkräftiger und optimistischer Teamplayer. Dann packe jetzt die Chance auf eine Karriere mit unbegrenzten Möglichkeiten!

Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of. Key Responsibilities Plan, execute and document analytical laboratory work for biologics, vaccines and CGT products for pre-clinical, clinical as well as commercial products Transfer, develop, validate and apply analytical methods, including ELISA/LBA, cell-based assays, Biacore, qPCR, flow cytometry, etc. Responsible for maintaining lab equipment and organize reagent supplies Transfer established methods to automated systems Ensure GMP-compliant documentation and process handling Contribute to scientific field or technique by solving scientific challenges within the department Key Requirements Training as Technical assistant, Bachelor, or Master’s Degree in Biochemistry, Biotechnology or related Life Science subject Experience working within the Bio-Pharmaceutical industry as a research or technical assistance Knowledgeable in several analytical methodologies, including mammalian cell culture, preparation of primary cells, ligand-binding assays (ELISA, HTRF, ECL), surface plasmon resonance, qPCR, automation, flow cytometry, etc. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

Description Debiopharm Group is a Swiss-headquartered global biopharmaceutical group active in the life science areas of drug development, GMP manufacturing of proprietary drugs, diagnostic tools and investment management. Debiopharm International SA is focused on the development of prescription drugs that target unmet medical needs. Debiopharm can offer you: An international and highly dynamic environment. For our Biostatistics and Data Management Department, we are looking for a: Senior Clinical Data Manager The Senior Clinical Data Manager is accountable for the quality and timelines of all Data Management deliverables for assigned clinical trials, including trials for which data management activities are outsourced to external providers. He/she ensures timely availability of complete, accurate and consistent clinical data to support internal decision making process. He/she is a key member of the clinical study team, and responsible for performing and/or overseeing the set-up, maintenance, control, cleaning and validation of clinical study databases, in compliance with SOPs and regulatory guidelines. He/she works closely with clinical trial managers, Medical directors and Biostatisticians and provides efficient data management support to the study team. Ensure study timelines are met and data quality is according to high industry standards Lock, transfer and archive databases. The opportunity to join a successful company, at the forefront of the most advanced scientific developments in the industry.

At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Description Apples AI/ML residency is a year long program inviting experts in various fields to apply their own domain expertise to build revolutionary machine learning and AI empowered products and experiences. Apple AI/ML residents will be matched with a machine learning research/engineering mentor, and will contribute to their teams research, product design, and development. Combining groundbreaking machine learning techniques with next-generation hardware, our teams take user experiences to the next level. Ideal candidates will also have experience in one of the following: HCI/design, linguistics, neuroscience, medicine, public health, biology, information retrieval, computer graphics, robotics, autonomous systems, applied math/statistics, physics, systems engineering, electrical engineering, sensors/signal processing, databases, distributed systems, data mining, econometrics, cognitive science, and psychology. Thesis, capstone project, internship, co-op, and/or industry experience in these fields will qualify. Education & Experience Graduate degree in a STEM field or equivalent industry experience in software engineering.

| Position summary Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312’000 people in 150 countries and territories. You are looking forward to share your knowledge and experience with others at Deloitte and to drive our culture of high quality and ambitions by guiding and coaching others. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Our Audit team is looking for you! Then we're the right company for you. As a member of our highly motivated, multicultural team, you can expect new challenges every day. Your qualifications Bachelor or Master degree in Accounting and Finance and you are at least in the 2nd your of your CPA or have finished your qualification (preferably Swiss CPA) You have 3-5 years’ experience in managing globally diversified and complex audits preferably in a Big4 company You are experience with IFRS or US-GAAP and your technical as well as your analytical skills are strong and outstanding. Your are experienced in building trusted relationships with customers and other stakeholders. You are very confident in communicating in German and English.

Liebherr - One Passion. The company ​Liebherr Machines Bulle SA is the centre of excellence for combustion engines (diesel and gas engines) and hydraulic components. Location Liebherr Machines Bulle SA 7, Rue Hans-Liebherr 1630Bulle Switzerland (CH) Contact Philipp TSCHUDI 0269133111 Responsibilities In this position your main responsibility will be to perform tests according to the specifications and guidelines either on functional engine testbeds, performance & emission testbeds or endurance testbeds Your scope of activities includes tasks such as the installation and deinstallation of the engine in the testbed, the connection, setup and configuration of measurement devices, the engine operation, use of testbed automation tools as well as the validation of test conformity. Additiopnally, you will maintain the daily documentation related to the engine and the installations You perform engine maintenance activities according to the service plan and update components according to the evolution of the product, carry out first level diagnosis in case of an engine failure and light engine repairs on the testbed You are the first point of contact for the test bench/ infrastructure team You ensure the creation of failure reports and inform the responsible persons if damage occurs to a component or an engine Besides, proposals can be made to enhance the test bed efficiency and operation, as well as the engine maintenance, functionality and reliability or engine performance Requirements You have successfully completed your education as light or heavy-duty mechatronics technician or internal combustion engine technician or a similar education You can ideally present several years of professional experience in the field of diesel and gas engines Additionally, you have acquired in-depth knowledge in measuring technologies and tests You possess fluent proficiency in French and good knowledge of English, German would be an advantage You have very good knowledge in MS-Office, besides good knowledge of an ERP system is desired You are interested in new technologies, you are open-minded and you proactively contribute to continuous improvement initiatives Your personality is characterised by a high team spirit, a sense of responsibility, commitment and flexibility Our offer Can we inspire you to take on a responsible position in a dynamic and independent family business? The workplace is located in Bulle, surrounded by the wonderful nature of the Gruyère region. Start planning your personal and professional development with us. Then we look forward to receiving your online application. Liebherr - One Passion. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care providers name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Ihre Aufgaben beinhalten im Wesentlichen:  Leitung und Unterstützung von Teilprojekten für den Aufbau der neuen Anlage  Definieren und Etablieren von Prozessen im Bereich aseptische Abfüllung und Lyophilisation  Erstellen von Prozess- und Risikoanalysen  Erstellen von Arbeitsanweisungen und Herstellverfahren  Erstellen von Schulungsdokumenten und Schulung der zukünftigen Produktionsmitarbeitenden der Anlage  Unterstützung bei Behördeninspektionen  Unterstützung des Leiters der neuen Anlage während der anschliessenden Routineproduktion  Enge Zusammenarbeit insbesondere mit internen und externen Partnern aus den Bereichen Engineering, Quality und Produktion    Sie bringen die folgenden Qualifikationen und Berufserfahrungen mit:    Abgeschlossenes Studium im naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich (FH/Universität)  Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung in der Chemie-, Pharma- oder Lebensmittelindustrie und im GMP-Umfeld  Selbstständige Arbeitsweise, schnelle Auffassungsgabe in der Bearbeitung von neuen Themen und im Aufbau von projektspezifischem Fachwissen  Fähigkeit mehrere Projekte gleichzeitig anzugehen und in hektischen Situationen den Überblick zu behalten  Proaktive Persönlichkeit, die es versteht mit Unsicherheiten umzugehen, bestehende Prozesse zu hinterfragen und Vorschläge einbringt  Teamfähige Person, die klar und offen kommuniziert und ihre Stakeholder aktiv einbindet  Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift)  Bereitschaft für projektabhängige Geschäftsreisen (v.a. Your responsibilities You are responsible for the market development in your sales region, bear the responsibility for orders received and create reliable forecasts for your sales region You will look after our customers throughout the entire life cycle of our products and acquire new customers in professional sales conversations You use your knowledge of customer needs and of ABB's solutions to advise on life cycle management, retrofits, upgrades, and digitalization and to offer customer-oriented solutions. Wir sind in der Wissenschaft tätig, jedoch gibt es keine Zauberformel dafür, wie wir die Arbeit angehen. Unsere wichtigste wissenschaftliche Lösung sind talentierte Mitarbeitende, die zusammenarbeiten und Ideen entwickeln, die anderen Unternehmen helfen, Menschen zu helfen. Roches Clinical Development organization is structured by therapeutic area and is responsible for developing and executing the late development (Phase IB III) clinical strategies and plans that deliver medically differentiated therapies that provide meaningful improvement to patients. Cross Functional Team Leadership: A key member of the Lifecycle Teams LT (GDL, LCL and IBL), representing Product Development (PD) Leads cross-functional, fit-for-purpose team(s) with a focus on product development, molecule or disease strategy (Development Working Groups, Clinical Science Team CST, as appropriate and assigned by the LCT LT) Represents PD/CD for assigned portfolio at the highest management/expert levels inside and outside Roche; includes championing and sponsoring the work of his/her staff Represents PD/CD on cross-functional strategic workstreams and initiatives as well as with internal (REDs, PD functions) and external (Business Development, Partnering, Scientific and Medical Societies, Therapeutic Area Experts, Regulatory Authorities) interactions Oversees multiple Clinical Development Plans (CDPs), disease strategies, molecules and/or indications, as well as associated clinical trial programs and studies. Supports his/her direct reports and/or other CD staff members in their communications and interactions with these external parties Works across Roche at all levels and with various groups and functions, such as other groups in PD, research, business development, manufacturing, commercial operations, legal, etc. Serves on joint executive committees, which include other Roche functions as well as external partner personnel, and/or assigns such responsibilities to direct reports Leads global CD strategy development for the assigned portfolio. Acts as a regular reviewer/presenter to various internal committees Acts as an expert advisor and consultant to various internal committees, other Roche management and teams regarding CD strategies, priorities, implementation and the like. Demonstrates, or proven abilities to demonstrate, Roche Values Clinical leadership: is recognized as a subject matter expert in his/her field (includes external recognition as an expert); able to evaluate, interpret and present highly complex data for a series of studies (prospective and retrospective); has made significant contributions to an organizations drug development (whether for Roche or another organization); has identified and created clinical development strategies that have led to label-enabling product definitions Has demonstrated outstanding leadership of multiple development projects and teams Proven abilities to plan and resource multiple development projects on short-, medium- and longer-term bases Outstanding organizational and time management skills; proven abilities to manage multiple, often complex and sometimes competing, objectives, goals and other priorities to effective and efficient conclusion Strategic agility: has in-depth knowledge and broad experience in the pharma/biotech industry and is able to bring this to bear in accomplishing strategic goals and objectives Outstanding judgment and decision-making skills; past results are indicative of consistently sound and effective business decisions Considerable comfort around all levels of management; has regularly demonstrated the managerial courage necessary to succeed at higher-levels within the organization Outstanding interpersonal skills; proven track record of building strong and sustainable relationships with internal & external partners/stakeholders Strong influencing skills; proven abilities to get things done without formal authority Strong negotiation skills; is highly adept at identifying solutions that will meet the needs of all parties involved Strong communication & presentation skills; exhibits professional maturity, confidence and competence. Knows how to summarize and communicate the key points and business case for others to effectively and expeditiously make important business decisions Strong conflict management skills; proactively minimizes situations where conflict may arise Strong conflict resolution skills; proven abilities to effectively and expeditiously reach satisfactory resolution among all involved parties Outstanding financial acumen: has a proven track record of achieving qualitative and quantitative results across multiple, often large-scale and complex clinical development projects Ability to travel globally ( Drug Development Expertise Scientific Expertise Medical Expertise Disease Expertise Leadership Strategic Agility Innovator and Competitive mindset Creative Mindset Collaboration and Communication Portfolio/Enterprise View #ASH20 Roche is an equal opportunity employer. JOB DESCRIPTION PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. with relevant medical experience in same/similar therapeutic area required 10 or more years pharma/biotech industry experience OR is a recognized expert in the field. A minimum of 4 years industry experience is preferred 4 or more years experience managing medical/clinical staff 8 or more years experience with clinical trials 2 or more years experience submitting NDAs/BLAs to regulatory authorities in Europe and/or the U.S. 4 or more years experience authoring global clinical development plans 4 or more years experience publishing results of clinical drug trials in referred journals (exact number of years depending on level) In-depth understanding of Phase I IV drug development Multidisciplinary experience in the pharma/biotech industry is strongly preferred (e.g., research, regulatory, clinical operations, business development, commercial operations, etc.) Demonstrates, or proven abilities to demonstrate, Roche Values Clinical leadership: is recognized as a subject matter expert in his/her field (includes external recognition as an expert); able to evaluate, interpret and present highly complex data for a series of studies (prospective and retrospective); has made significant contributions to an organizations drug development (whether for Roche or another organization); Sobald der Berufsbilder, der Lehrlingsverantwortliche sowie du überzeugt sind, dass du die / der richtige Lernende für unsere Lehrestelle bist, steht einem Lehrvertrag nichts mehr im Wege. employer_description: Competitive Intelligence (CI) is a team of strategists with diverse backgrounds within GLIDE that synthesizes medical, scientific, and commercial information from the external environment to drive decision-making for the Roche/Genentech portfolio. Job Description In this position, with minimal guidance from more senior members of the team, you will be primarily accountable for consistently and effectively: Being an expert in leading key competitor monitoring and analysis Ability to identify shifting standards of care, emerging development trends, and potential opportunities for future development for our molecules Recognition of emergent agents, MoAs, platforms, and modalities to identify threats and opportunities Ability to accurately forecast competitor launch timelines and probabilities, identify critical competitors and data Lead or influence key internal development and commercialization decisions Drive translation of competitive findings into business recommendations that deliver success for the organization Data expert to assure that impactful, actionable competitor information and Roche product differentiation is identified and taken into account during key decisions via strategic workshops or other venues Identify opportunities to improve high-level pharma portfolio strategy or Roche organization structure and decision-making by drawing on case examples or other information from the external environment Actively identifying CI information, data collection, and insight communication to varied stakeholders Based on knowledge of impending strategic decisions, identify available data sources, collect competitive intelligence, and synthesize information for commercial, medical, and scientific leaders Manage external vendor relationships for collection and structuring of CI data including planning and execution of CI at medical/scientific conferences Comply with all laws, regulations and policies that govern the ethical conduct of Roche activities Collaborating with many other functions Ensure cross functional stakeholder alignment within the Therapeutic Area / Business Franchise in support of CI initiatives and deliverables and ensure alignment with broader GLIDE Partnering across GPS, Medical, Product Development, REDs, Partnering, and other functions Supporting CI team growth Identification and execution of ways to improve the work processes of CI and grow the group’s impact within the organization Qualifications - Internal Bachelor’s Degree (life sciences or related discipline is a plus); MBA, MD, or PhD in a life sciences, technical, or analytical discipline is preferred Complex strategic project leadership experience in a matrixed environment--specific examples of influence in strategy decisions will be required Fluency in written and spoken Functional Information Security & Privacy Expert Who we are At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. The Position Roche has embarked on a comprehensive Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) initiative - ASPIRE - to integrate all core processes across Finance, Procurement and Technical Operations needed to run a company into a single, transparent and efficient system using the latest SAP ERP technology. The Functional Information Security & Privacy Expertis responsible for the execution of the Roche Group Information Security Management System within Roche ERP for the ASPIRE Program. The Roche Information Security Management System (ISMS) is a framework of policies, directives, standards, guidelines, processes and organizational capabilities designed to maintain compliance with security standards, laws and regulations to ensure Roche's right to operate. The Global Information Security & Privacy Governance Organization is accountable for the ISMS and is the 2nd line-of-control for the Roche Group. Your responsibilities include: Close collaboration with the Global Information Security & Privacy organisation and participation in a network of Information Security & Privacy Representatives from across the Roche Group. RepresentRoche ERP and IT ASPIRE in Global Information Security & Privacy programs for continuous improvement to the global ISMS. In addition, you bring the following qualifications: An interest in privacy and security topics with proven knowledge in governance, risk and compliance and relevant legal and regulatory standards in the healthcare industry Good understanding of Information Technology, new trends in IT and their impact on ISEC and privacy Ability to advise and influence all levels of the organization Ability to work within a Federated Security & Privacy Governance Model with the Group Information Security & Privacy organization Serve as first-line-of-control in collaboration with Group Information Security & Privacy organization as second-line-of-control Ability to collaborate with a broad community of security and privacy practitioners Excellent oral and written communication skills in English Please apply until 14.08.2020 Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Roche is an equal opportunity employer. The Functional Information Security & Privacy Expertis responsible for the execution of the Roche Group Information Security Management System within Roche ERP for the ASPIRE Program. Please submit a complete application, including CV, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

employer_description: | Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer At Credit Suisse, we're proud that Internal Audit is seen as a compelling voice inspiring confidence in the ability of the Bank to deliver its strategy. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. | Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. We are Credit Suisse. Our Auditors build and maintain direct and lasting relationships with the Bank's leadership. To complete our audit team covering International Wealth Management in Zurich we are seeking to recruit a Senior Auditor. Join us and you will : learn state of the art audit methodologies contribute during audit planning, field work and presentation of findings to senior management, in close collaboration with the Audit Manager have the opportunity to demonstrate your leadership by supervising and monitoring audits to ensure efficient and high quality delivery against agreed timeframes have the opportunity to be a trusted advisor and partner with major business and support functions across our organization enhance your understanding of the Bank by working on a wide range of different global and local audits across the Bank assist in a variety of bank-wide initiatives and special projects benefit from significant investments in your career development via our Audit Academy You Offer Ideally, you hold an undergraduate degree and have an interest in Financial Services Having gathered at least 5 years of work experience relating to audit, accountancy or in the financial industry is advantageous You have an understanding of risk and how controls can mitigate those risks while being commercial You can contribute with your extraordinary analytical skills and precision in delivery, which when paired with an understanding of regulatory topics sets you apart You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German, French, Italian or Spanish would be an asset) and can present in a simple and concise way You are an avid learner and a dedicated problem solver with a can-do attitude Your strong interpersonal skills, multi-tasking and time management skills enable you to quickly gain trust and deliver effectively towards deadlines You are keen to work in an inclusive environment and excel at collaborating in a global team About the team : We are a global team that encourages diversity of thought. Our offices are located in Zurich, London, Luxembourg, Warsaw, Wroclaw, New York, Raleigh, Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo and Pune. Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer.

Position summary Manager/ Senior Manager Deloitte Forensic, Financial Advisory, Zurich (80-100%) Deloitte is a leading global accounting and consulting company, with approximately 312000 people in 150 countries and territories. Deloitte Forensic is one of the largest forensic advisory practices in Switzerland. Deloitte Forensic assists clients across a broad spectrum of industries by providing specialist advice relating to fraud, anti-bribery and corruption, anti-money laundering and regulatory investigations. Deloitte offers you national and international career opportunities as well as a broad internal and external training program. Please submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates, using our online career portal www.deloitte.com/careers. If you have any questions, please contact our talent team at talent@deloitte.ch. Deloitte AG and Deloitte Consulting AG are Swiss subsidiaries of Deloitte LLP, the DTTL member firm in the United Kingdom. In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory and Tax & Legal. With more than 2,000 employees at six locations in Basel, Berne, Geneva, Lausanne, Lugano and Zurich, we serve companies and organisations of all legal forms and sizes in all industry sectors. Our Forensic team is looking for you! Deloitte Forensic is one of the largest forensic advisory practices in Switzerland. Deloitte Forensic assists clients across a broad spectrum of industries by providing specialist advice relating to fraud, anti-bribery and corruption, anti-money laundering and regulatory investigations.
